abort_index_segment_size.description: Capacity (in number of txns) of an abort index segment. Each partition tracks the aborted transaction offset ranges to help service client requests.If the number transactions increase beyond this threshold, they are flushed to disk to easy memory pressure.Then they're loaded on demand. This configuration controls the maximum number of aborted transactions  before they are flushed to disk.
abort_index_segment_size.name: abort_index_segment_size

abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms.description: Interval, in milliseconds, at which Redpanda looks for inactive transactions and aborts them.
abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms.name: abort_timed_out_transactions_interval_ms

admin.description: Network address for the Admin API[] server.
admin.name: admin

admin_api_doc_dir.description: Path to the API specifications for the Admin API.
admin_api_doc_dir.name: admin_api_doc_dir

admin_api_require_auth.description: Whether Admin API clients must provide HTTP basic authentication headers.
admin_api_require_auth.name: admin_api_require_auth

admin_api_tls.description: Specifies the TLS configuration for the HTTP Admin API.
admin_api_tls.name: admin_api_tls

advertised_pandaproxy_api.description: Network address for the HTTP Proxy API server to publish to clients.
advertised_pandaproxy_api.name: advertised_pandaproxy_api

aggregate_metrics.description: Enable aggregation of metrics returned by the `/metrics` endpoint. Aggregation can simplify monitoring by providing summarized data instead of raw, per-instance metrics. Metric aggregation is performed by summing the values of samples by labels and is done when it makes sense by the shard and/or partition labels.
aggregate_metrics.name: aggregate_metrics

alive_timeout_ms.description: The amount of time since the last broker status heartbeat. After this time, a broker is considered offline and not alive.
alive_timeout_ms.name: alive_timeout_ms

alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms.description: The duration, in milliseconds, that Redpanda waits for the replication of entries in the controller log when executing a request to alter topic configurations. This timeout ensures that configuration changes are replicated across the cluster before the alteration request is considered complete.
alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms.name: alter_topic_cfg_timeout_ms

append_chunk_size.description: Size of direct write operations to disk in bytes. A larger chunk size can improve performance for write-heavy workloads, but increase latency for these writes as more data is collected before each write operation. A smaller chunk size can decrease write latency, but potentially increase the number of disk I/O operations.
append_chunk_size.name: append_chunk_size

audit_client_max_buffer_size.description: Defines the number of bytes allocated by the internal audit client for audit messages. When changing this, you must disable audit logging and then re-enable it for the change to take effect. Consider increasing this if your system generates a very large number of audit records in a short amount of time.
audit_client_max_buffer_size.name: audit_client_max_buffer_size

audit_enabled.description: Enables or disables audit logging. When you set this to true, Redpanda checks for an existing topic named `_redpanda.audit_log`. If none is found, Redpanda automatically creates one for you.
audit_enabled.name: audit_enabled

audit_enabled_event_types.description: List of strings in JSON style identifying the event types to include in the audit log. This may include any of the following: `management, produce, consume, describe, heartbeat, authenticate, schema_registry, admin`.
audit_enabled_event_types.name: audit_enabled_event_types

audit_excluded_principals.description: List of user principals to exclude from auditing.
audit_excluded_principals.name: audit_excluded_principals

audit_excluded_topics.description: List of topics to exclude from auditing.
audit_excluded_topics.name: audit_excluded_topics

audit_failure_policy.description: Defines the policy for rejecting audit log messages when the audit log queue is full. If set to 'permit', then new audit messages are dropped and the operation is permitted.  If set to 'reject', then the operation is rejected.
audit_failure_policy.name: audit_failure_policy

audit_log_num_partitions.description: Defines the number of partitions used by a newly-created audit topic. This configuration applies only to the audit log topic and may be different from the cluster or other topic configurations. This cannot be altered for existing audit log topics.
audit_log_num_partitions.name: audit_log_num_partitions

audit_log_replication_factor.description: Defines the replication factor for a newly-created audit log topic. This configuration applies only to the audit log topic and may be different from the cluster or other topic configurations. This cannot be altered for existing audit log topics. Setting this value is optional. If a value is not provided, Redpanda will use the value specified for `internal_topic_replication_factor`.
audit_log_replication_factor.name: audit_log_replication_factor

audit_queue_drain_interval_ms.description: Interval, in milliseconds, at which Redpanda flushes the queued audit log messages to the audit log topic. Longer intervals may help prevent duplicate messages, especially in high throughput scenarios, but they also increase the risk of data loss during shutdowns where the queue is lost.
audit_queue_drain_interval_ms.name: audit_queue_drain_interval_ms

audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard.description: Defines the maximum amount of memory in bytes used by the audit buffer in each shard. Once this size is reached, requests to log additional audit messages will return a non-retryable error. Limiting the buffer size per shard helps prevent any single shard from consuming excessive memory due to audit log messages.
audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard.name: audit_queue_max_buffer_size_per_shard

auto_create_topics_enabled.description: Allow automatic topic creation. To prevent excess topics, this property is not supported on Redpanda Cloud BYOC and Dedicated clusters. You should explicitly manage topic creation for these Redpanda Cloud clusters. If you produce to a topic that doesn't exist, the topic will be created with defaults if this property is enabled.
auto_create_topics_enabled.name: auto_create_topics_enabled

broker_tls.description: TLS configuration for the Kafka API servers to which the HTTP Proxy client should connect.
broker_tls.name: broker_tls

brokers.description: Network addresses of the Kafka API servers to which the HTTP Proxy client should connect.
brokers.name: brokers

client_cache_max_size.description: The maximum number of Kafka client connections that Redpanda can cache in the LRU (least recently used) cache. The LRU cache helps optimize resource utilization by keeping the most recently used clients in memory, facilitating quicker reconnections for frequent clients while limiting memory usage.
client_cache_max_size.name: client_cache_max_size

client_identifier.description: Custom identifier to include in the Kafka request header for the HTTP Proxy client. This identifier can help debug or monitor client activities.
client_identifier.name: client_identifier

client_keep_alive.description: Time, in milliseconds, that an idle client connection may remain open to the HTTP Proxy API.
client_keep_alive.name: client_keep_alive

cloud_storage_access_key.description: AWS or GCP access key. This access key is part of the credentials that Redpanda requires to authenticate with object storage services for Tiered Storage. This access key is used with the <<cloud_storage_secret_key>> to form the complete credentials required for authentication. To authenticate using IAM roles, see cloud_storage_credentials_source.
cloud_storage_access_key.name: cloud_storage_access_key

cloud_storage_api_endpoint.description: Optional API endpoint. - AWS: When blank, this is automatically generated using <<cloud_storage_region,region>> and <<cloud_storage_bucket,bucket>>. Otherwise, this uses the value assigned. - GCP: Uses `storage.googleapis.com`.
cloud_storage_api_endpoint.name: cloud_storage_api_endpoint

cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on.description: When set to `true`, Redpanda automatically retrieves cluster metadata from a specified object storage bucket at the cluster's first startup. This option is ideal for orchestrated deployments, such as Kubernetes. Ensure any previous cluster linked to the bucket is fully decommissioned to prevent conflicts between Tiered Storage subsystems.
cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on.name: cloud_storage_attempt_cluster_restore_on_bootstrap

cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint.description: Azure Data Lake Storage v2 endpoint override. Use when hierarchical namespaces are enabled on your storage account and you have set up a custom endpoint.
cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint.name: cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint

cloud_storage_azure_adls_port.description: Azure Data Lake Storage v2 port override. See also `cloud_storage_azure_adls_endpoint`. Use when Hierarchical Namespaces are enabled on your storage account and you have set up a custom endpoint.
cloud_storage_azure_adls_port.name: cloud_storage_azure_adls_port

cloud_storage_azure_container.description: The name of the Azure container to use with Tiered Storage. If `null`, the property is disabled. The container must belong to cloud_storage_azure_storage_account.
cloud_storage_azure_container.name: cloud_storage_azure_container

cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespa.description: Whether or not an Azure hierarchical namespace is enabled on the `cloud_storage_azure_storage_account`. If this property is not set, ´cloud_storage_azure_shared_key` must be set, and each node tries to determine at startup if a hierarchical namespace is enabled. Setting this property to `true` disables the check and treats a hierarchical namespace as active. Setting to `false` disables the check and treats a hierarchical namespace as not active.
cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespa.name: cloud_storage_azure_hierarchical_namespace_enabled

cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id.description: The managed identity ID to use for access to the Azure storage account. To use Azure managed identities, you must set `cloud_storage_credentials_source` to `azure_vm_instance_metadata`.
cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id.name: cloud_storage_azure_managed_identity_id

cloud_storage_azure_shared_key.description: The shared key to be used for Azure Shared Key authentication with the Azure storage account configured by `cloud_storage_azure_storage_account`.  If `null`, the property is disabled. Redpanda expects this key string to be Base64 encoded.
cloud_storage_azure_shared_key.name: cloud_storage_azure_shared_key

cloud_storage_azure_storage_account.description: The name of the Azure storage account to use with Tiered Storage. If `null`, the property is disabled.
cloud_storage_azure_storage_account.name: cloud_storage_azure_storage_account

cloud_storage_backend.description: Optional object storage backend variant used to select API capabilities. If not supplied, this will be inferred from other configuration properties. Accepted values: [`unknown`, `aws`, `google_s3_compat`, `azure`, `minio`]
cloud_storage_backend.name: cloud_storage_backend

cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota.description: The total number of requests the object storage background jobs can make during one background housekeeping run. This is a per-shard limit. Adjusting this limit can optimize object storage traffic and impact shard performance.
cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota.name: cloud_storage_background_jobs_quota

cloud_storage_bucket.description: AWS or GCP bucket or container that should be used to store data.
cloud_storage_bucket.name: cloud_storage_bucket

cloud_storage_cache_check_interval_ms.description: Minimum interval between Tiered Storage cache trims, measured in milliseconds. This setting dictates the cooldown period after a cache trim operation before another trim can occur. If a cache fetch operation requests a trim but the interval since the last trim has not yet passed, the trim will be postponed until this cooldown expires. Adjusting this interval helps manage the balance between cache size and retrieval performance.
cloud_storage_cache_check_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_cache_check_interval

cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size.description: Size of chunks of segments downloaded into object storage cache. Reduces space usage by only downloading the necessary chunk from a segment.
cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size.name: cloud_storage_cache_chunk_size

cloud_storage_cache_directory.description: Directory for archival cache. Should be present when `cloud_storage_enabled` is present
cloud_storage_cache_directory.name: cloud_storage_cache_directory

cloud_storage_cache_max_objects.description: Maximum number of objects that may be held in the Tiered Storage cache.  This applies simultaneously with `cloud_storage_cache_size`, and whichever limit is hit first will trigger trimming of the cache.
cloud_storage_cache_max_objects.name: cloud_storage_cache_max_objects

cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets.description: Divide the object storage cache across the specified number of buckets. This only works for objects with randomized prefixes. The names are not changed when the value is set to zero.
cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets.name: cloud_storage_cache_num_buckets

cloud_storage_cache_size.description: Maximum size of object storage cache. If both this property and cloud_storage_cache_size_percent are set, Redpanda uses the minimum of the two.
cloud_storage_cache_size.name: cloud_storage_cache_size

cloud_storage_cache_size_percent.description: Maximum size of the cloud cache as a percentage of unreserved disk space disk_reservation_percent. The default value for this option is tuned for a shared disk configuration. Consider increasing the value if using a dedicated cache disk. The property <<cloud_storage_cache_size,`cloud_storage_cache_size`>> controls the same limit expressed as a fixed number of bytes. If both `cloud_storage_cache_size` and `cloud_storage_cache_size_percent` are set, Redpanda uses the minimum of the two.
cloud_storage_cache_size_percent.name: cloud_storage_cache_size_percent

cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes.description: The cache performs a recursive directory inspection during the cache trim. The information obtained during the inspection can be carried over to the next trim operation. This parameter sets a limit on the memory occupied by objects that can be carried over from one trim to next, and allows cache to quickly unblock readers before starting the directory inspection (deprecated)
cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes.name: cloud_storage_cache_trim_carryover_bytes

cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_perce.description: Trim is triggered when the cache reaches this percent of the maximum object count. If this is unset, the default behavioris to start trim when the cache is about 100% full.
cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_perce.name: cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_percent_objects

cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_perce.description: Trim is triggered when the cache reaches this percent of the maximum cache size. If this is unset, the default behavioris to start trim when the cache is about 100% full.
cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_perce.name: cloud_storage_cache_trim_threshold_percent_size

cloud_storage_cache_trim_walk_concurrenc.description: The maximum number of concurrent tasks launched for directory walk during cache trimming. A higher number allows cache trimming to run faster but can cause latency spikes due to increased pressure on I/O subsystem and syscall threads.
cloud_storage_cache_trim_walk_concurrenc.name: cloud_storage_cache_trim_walk_concurrency

cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy.description: Selects a strategy for evicting unused cache chunks.
cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy.name: cloud_storage_chunk_eviction_strategy

cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch.description: Number of chunks to prefetch ahead of every downloaded chunk
cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch.name: cloud_storage_chunk_prefetch

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consu.description: Number of groups to upload in a single snapshot object during consumer offsets upload. Setting a lower value will mean a larger number of smaller snapshots are uploaded.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consu.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_num_consumer_groups_per_upload

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries.description: Number of attempts metadata operations may be retried.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_retries

cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_in.description: Time interval to wait between cluster metadata uploads.
cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_in.name: cloud_storage_cluster_metadata_upload_interval_ms

cloud_storage_credentials_host.description: The hostname to connect to for retrieving role based credentials. Derived from cloud_storage_credentials_source if not set. Only required when using IAM role based access. To authenticate using access keys, see `cloud_storage_access_key`.
cloud_storage_credentials_host.name: cloud_storage_credentials_host

cloud_storage_credentials_source.description: The source of credentials used to authenticate to object storage services. Required for cluster provider authentication with IAM roles. To authenticate using access keys, see cloud_storage_access_key`. Accepted values: `config_file`, `aws_instance_metadata`, `sts, gcp_instance_metadata`, `azure_vm_instance_metadata`, `azure_aks_oidc_federation`
cloud_storage_credentials_source.name: cloud_storage_credentials_source

cloud_storage_crl_file.description: Path to certificate revocation list for `cloud_storage_trust_file`.
cloud_storage_crl_file.name: cloud_storage_crl_file

cloud_storage_disable_archival_stm_rw_fe.description: Disable concurrency control mechanism in the Tiered-Storage. This could potentially break the metadata consistency and shouldn't be used in production systems. It should only be used for testing.
cloud_storage_disable_archival_stm_rw_fe.name: cloud_storage_disable_archival_stm_rw_fence

cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager.description: Use legacy upload mode and do not start archiver_manager.
cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager.name: cloud_storage_disable_archiver_manager

cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads.description: Disable chunk reads and switch back to legacy mode where full segments are downloaded.
cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads.name: cloud_storage_disable_chunk_reads

cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_.description: Begins the read replica sync loop in tiered-storage-enabled topic partitions. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_.name: cloud_storage_disable_read_replica_loop_for_tests

cloud_storage_disable_remote_labels_for_.description: If 'true', Redpanda disables remote labels and falls back on the hash-based object naming scheme for new topics. This property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
cloud_storage_disable_remote_labels_for_.name: cloud_storage_disable_remote_labels_for_tests

cloud_storage_disable_tls.description: Disable TLS for all object storage connections.
cloud_storage_disable_tls.name: cloud_storage_disable_tls

cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency.description: Disable all upload consistency checks. This will allow redpanda to upload logs with gaps and replicate metadata with consistency violations. Normally, this options should be disabled.
cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency.name: cloud_storage_disable_upload_consistency_checks

cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_te.description: Begins the upload loop in tiered-storage-enabled topic partitions. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in production.
cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_te.name: cloud_storage_disable_upload_loop_for_tests

cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reu.description: Enable re-uploading data for compacted topics
cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reu.name: cloud_storage_enable_compacted_topic_reupload

cloud_storage_enable_remote_allow_gaps.description: Controls the eviction of locally-stored log segments when Tiered Storage uploads are paused. Set to `false` (default) to only evict data that has already been uploaded to cloud storage. If the retained data fills the local volume, Redpanda will throttle producers. Set to `true` to allow the eviction of locally-stored log segments, which may create gaps in offsets.
cloud_storage_enable_remote_allow_gaps.name: cloud_storage_enable_remote_allow_gaps

cloud_storage_enable_remote_read.description: Default remote read config value for new topics
cloud_storage_enable_remote_read.name: cloud_storage_enable_remote_read

cloud_storage_enable_remote_write.description: Default remote write value for new topics
cloud_storage_enable_remote_write.name: cloud_storage_enable_remote_write

cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing.description: Enable scrubbing of cloud storage partitions. The scrubber validates the integrity of data and metadata uploaded to cloud storage.
cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing.name: cloud_storage_enable_scrubbing

cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging.description: Enables adjacent segment merging. The segments are reuploaded if there is an opportunity for that and if it will improve the tiered-storage performance
cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging.name: cloud_storage_enable_segment_merging

cloud_storage_enable_segment_uploads.description: Controls the upload of log segments to Tiered Storage. If set to false, this property temporarily pauses all log segment uploads from the Redpanda cluster. When the uploads are paused, the 'cloud_storage_enable_remote_allow_gaps' cluster configuration and 'redpanda.remote.allowgaps' topic properties control local retention behavior.
cloud_storage_enable_segment_uploads.name: cloud_storage_enable_segment_uploads

cloud_storage_enabled.description: Enable object storage. Must be set to `true` to use Tiered Storage or Remote Read Replicas.
cloud_storage_enabled.name: cloud_storage_enabled

cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms.description: Time interval between a final scrub and the next.
cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_full_scrub_interval_ms

cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for running the cloud storage garbage collection (ms).
cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_garbage_collect_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_.description: Time limit on waiting for uploads to complete before a leadership transfer.  If this is null, leadership transfers will proceed without waiting.
cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_.name: cloud_storage_graceful_transfer_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms.description: Interval for cloud storage housekeeping tasks.
cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_housekeeping_interval_ms

cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segmen.description: The maximum number of chunks per segment that can be hydrated at a time. Above this number, unused chunks will be trimmed.
cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segmen.name: cloud_storage_hydrated_chunks_per_segment_ratio

cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms.description: Duration to wait for a hydration request to be fulfilled, if hydration is not completed within this time, the consumer will be notified with a timeout error.
cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_hydration_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps.description: The cloud storage request rate threshold for idle state detection. If the average request rate for the configured period is lower than this threshold the cloud storage is considered being idle.
cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps.name: cloud_storage_idle_threshold_rps

cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms.description: Timeout used to detect idle state of the cloud storage API. If the average cloud storage request rate is below this threshold for a configured amount of time the cloud storage is considered idle and the housekeeping jobs are started.
cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_idle_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms.description: Initial backoff time for exponential backoff algorithm (ms)
cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms.name: cloud_storage_initial_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_inventory_based_scrub_enab.description: Scrubber uses the latest cloud storage inventory report, if available, to check if the required objects exist in the bucket or container.
cloud_storage_inventory_based_scrub_enab.name: cloud_storage_inventory_based_scrub_enabled

cloud_storage_inventory_hash_store.description: Directory to store inventory report hashes for use by cloud storage scrubber
cloud_storage_inventory_hash_store.name: cloud_storage_inventory_hash_path_directory

cloud_storage_inventory_id.description: The name of the scheduled inventory job created by Redpanda to generate bucket or container inventory reports.
cloud_storage_inventory_id.name: cloud_storage_inventory_id

cloud_storage_inventory_max_hash_size_du.description: Maximum bytes of hashes which will be held in memory before writing data to disk during inventory report parsing. Affects the number of files written by inventory service to disk during report parsing, as when this limit is reached new files are written to disk.
cloud_storage_inventory_max_hash_size_du.name: cloud_storage_inventory_max_hash_size_during_parse

cloud_storage_inventory_report_check_int.description: Time interval between checks for a new inventory report in the cloud storage bucket or container.
cloud_storage_inventory_report_check_int.name: cloud_storage_inventory_report_check_interval_ms

cloud_storage_inventory_reports_prefix.description: The prefix to the path in the cloud storage bucket or container where inventory reports will be placed.
cloud_storage_inventory_reports_prefix.name: cloud_storage_inventory_reports_prefix

cloud_storage_inventory_self_managed_rep.description: If enabled, Redpanda will not attempt to create the scheduled report configuration using cloud storage APIs. The scrubbing process will look for reports in the expected paths in the bucket or container, and use the latest report found. Primarily intended for use in testing and on backends where scheduled inventory reports are not supported.
cloud_storage_inventory_self_managed_rep.name: cloud_storage_inventory_self_managed_report_config

cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size.description: Amount of memory that can be used to handle tiered-storage metadata
cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size.name: cloud_storage_manifest_cache_size

cloud_storage_manifest_cache_ttl_ms.description: The time interval that determines how long the materialized manifest can stay in cache under contention. This parameter is used for performance tuning. When the spillover manifest is materialized and stored in cache and the cache needs to evict it it will use 'cloud_storage_materialized_manifest_ttl_ms' value as a timeout. The cursor that uses the spillover manifest uses this value as a TTL interval after which it stops referencing the manifest making it available for eviction. This only affects spillover manifests under contention.
cloud_storage_manifest_cache_ttl_ms.name: cloud_storage_materialized_manifest_ttl_ms

cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interv.description: Wait at least this long between partition manifest uploads. Actual time between uploads may be greater than this interval. If this property is not set, or null, metadata will be updated after each segment upload.
cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interv.name: cloud_storage_manifest_max_upload_interval_sec

cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_.description: Maximum concurrent segment hydrations of remote data per CPU core.  If unset, value of `cloud_storage_max_connections / 2` is used, which means that half of available S3 bandwidth could be used to download data from S3. If the cloud storage cache is empty every new segment reader will require a download. This will lead to 1:1 mapping between number of partitions scanned by the fetch request and number of parallel downloads. If this value is too large the downloads can affect other workloads. In case of any problem caused by the tiered-storage reads this value can be lowered. This will only affect segment hydrations (downloads) but won't affect cached segments. If fetch request is reading from the tiered-storage cache its concurrency will only be limited by available memory.
cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_.name: cloud_storage_max_concurrent_hydrations_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_connections.description: Maximum simultaneous object storage connections per shard, applicable to upload and download activities.
cloud_storage_max_connections.name: cloud_storage_max_connections

cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_.description: Maximum concurrent readers of remote data per CPU core.  If unset, value of `topic_partitions_per_shard` multiplied by 2 is used.
cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_.name: cloud_storage_max_materialized_segments_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_sh.description: Maximum concurrent I/O cursors of materialized remote segments per CPU core.  If unset, value of `topic_partitions_per_shard` is used, i.e. one segment reader per partition if the shard is at its maximum partition capacity.  These readers are cachedacross Kafka consume requests and store a readahead buffer.
cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_sh.name: cloud_storage_max_segment_readers_per_shard

cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_delet.description: The per-partition limit for the number of segments pending deletion from the cloud. Segments can be deleted due to retention or compaction. If this limit is breached and deletion fails, then segments will be orphaned in the cloud and will have to be removed manually
cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_delet.name: cloud_storage_max_segments_pending_deletion_per_partition

cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard.description: Max throughput used by tiered-storage per shard in bytes per second. This value is an upper bound of the throughput available to the tiered-storage subsystem. This parameter is intended to be used as a safeguard and in tests when we need to set precise throughput value independent of actual storage media. Please use 'cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent' instead of this parameter in the production environment.
cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard.name: cloud_storage_max_throughput_per_shard

cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_thr.description: The minimum number of chunks per segment for trimming to be enabled. If the number of chunks in a segment is below this threshold, the segment is small enough that all chunks in it can be hydrated at any given time
cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_thr.name: cloud_storage_min_chunks_per_segment_threshold

cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms.description: Time interval between two partial scrubs of the same partition.
cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms.name: cloud_storage_partial_scrub_interval_ms

cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_.description: Timeout to check if new data is available for partition in S3 for read replica.
cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_.name: cloud_storage_readreplica_manifest_sync_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retenti.description: Retention in bytes for topics created during automated recovery
cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retenti.name: cloud_storage_recovery_temporary_retention_bytes_default

cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.description: Number of metadata segments to validate, from newest to oldest, when `cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_mode` is set to `check_manifest_and_segment_metadata`.
cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.name: cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_depth

cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.description: Validation performed before recovering a topic from object storage. In case of failure, the reason for the failure appears as `ERROR` lines in the Redpanda application log. For each topic, this reports errors for all partitions, but for each partition, only the first error is reported. This property accepts the following parameters: `no_check`: Skips the checks for topic recovery. `check_manifest_existence`:  Runs an existence check on each `partition_manifest`. Fails if there are connection issues to the object storage. `check_manifest_and_segment_metadata`: Downloads the manifest and runs a consistency check, comparing the metadata with the cloud storage objects. The process fails if metadata references any missing cloud storage objects.
cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_.name: cloud_storage_recovery_topic_validation_mode

cloud_storage_region.description: Cloud provider region that houses the bucket or container used for storage.
cloud_storage_region.name: cloud_storage_region

cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for IAM role related operations (ms)
cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms.name: cloud_storage_roles_operation_timeout_ms

cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_.description: Jitter applied to the cloud storage scrubbing interval.
cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_.name: cloud_storage_scrubbing_interval_jitter_ms

cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interva.description: Time that segment can be kept locally without uploading it to the remote storage (sec).
cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interva.name: cloud_storage_segment_max_upload_interval_sec

cloud_storage_segment_size_min.description: Smallest acceptable segment size in the cloud storage. Default: cloud_storage_segment_size_target/2
cloud_storage_segment_size_min.name: cloud_storage_segment_size_min

cloud_storage_segment_size_target.description: Desired segment size in the cloud storage. Default: segment.bytes
cloud_storage_segment_size_target.name: cloud_storage_segment_size_target

cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_seg.description: Maximum number of elements in the spillover manifest that can be offloaded to the cloud storage. This property is similar to 'cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size' but it triggers spillover based on number of segments instead of the size of the manifest in bytes. The property exists to simplify testing and shouldn't be set in the production environment
cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_seg.name: cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_max_segments

cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size.description: The size of the manifest which can be offloaded to the cloud. If the size of the local manifest stored in redpanda exceeds cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size x2 the spillover mechanism will split the manifest into two parts and one of them will be uploaded to S3.
cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size.name: cloud_storage_spillover_manifest_size

cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent.description: Max throughput used by tiered-storage per node expressed as a percentage of the disk bandwidth. If the server has several disks Redpanda will take into account only the one which is used to store tiered-storage cache. Note that even if the tiered-storage is allowed to use full bandwidth of the disk (100%) it won't necessary use it in full. The actual usage depend on your workload and the state of the tiered-storage cache. This parameter is a safeguard that prevents tiered-storage from using too many system resources and not a performance tuning knob.
cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent.name: cloud_storage_throughput_limit_percent

cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_m.description: Grace period during which the purger will refuse to purge the topic.
cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_m.name: cloud_storage_topic_purge_grace_period_ms

cloud_storage_trust_file.description: Path to certificate that should be used to validate server certificate during TLS handshake.
cloud_storage_trust_file.name: cloud_storage_trust_file

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff.description: derivative coefficient for upload PID controller.
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_d_coeff

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares.description: maximum number of IO and CPU shares that archival upload can use
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_max_shares

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares.description: minimum number of IO and CPU shares that archival upload can use
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_min_shares

cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff.description: proportional coefficient for upload PID controller
cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff.name: cloud_storage_upload_ctrl_p_coeff

cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backof.description: Initial backoff interval when there is nothing to upload for a partition (ms).
cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backof.name: cloud_storage_upload_loop_initial_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms.description: Max backoff interval when there is nothing to upload for a partition (ms).
cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms.name: cloud_storage_upload_loop_max_backoff_ms

cloud_storage_url_style.description: Specifies the addressing style to use for Amazon S3 requests. This configuration determines how S3 bucket URLs are formatted. You can choose between: `virtual_host`, (for example, `<bucket-name>.s3.amazonaws.com`), `path`, (for example, `s3.amazonaws.com/<bucket-name>`), and `null`. Path style is supported for backward compatibility with legacy systems. When this property is not set or is `null`, the client tries to use `virtual_host` addressing. If the initial request fails, the client automatically tries the `path` style. If neither addressing style works, Redpanda terminates the startup, requiring manual configuration to proceed.
cloud_storage_url_style.name: cloud_storage_url_style

compacted_log_segment_size.description: Size (in bytes) for each compacted log segment.
compacted_log_segment_size.name: compacted_log_segment_size

compaction_ctrl_backlog_size.description: Target backlog size for compaction controller. If not set the max backlog size is configured to 80% of total disk space available.
compaction_ctrl_backlog_size.name: compaction_ctrl_backlog_size

compaction_ctrl_d_coeff.description: Derivative coefficient for compaction PID controller.
compaction_ctrl_d_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_d_coeff

compaction_ctrl_i_coeff.description: Integral coefficient for compaction PID controller.
compaction_ctrl_i_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_i_coeff

compaction_ctrl_max_shares.description: Maximum number of I/O and CPU shares that compaction process can use.
compaction_ctrl_max_shares.name: compaction_ctrl_max_shares

compaction_ctrl_min_shares.description: Minimum number of I/O and CPU shares that compaction process can use.
compaction_ctrl_min_shares.name: compaction_ctrl_min_shares

compaction_ctrl_p_coeff.description: Proportional coefficient for compaction PID controller. This must be negative, because the compaction backlog should decrease when the number of compaction shares increases.
compaction_ctrl_p_coeff.name: compaction_ctrl_p_coeff

consumer_group_lag_collection_interval.description: How often to run the collection loop when enable_consumer_group_metrics contains consumer_lag
consumer_group_lag_collection_interval.name: consumer_group_lag_collection_interval_sec

consumer_instance_timeout.description: How long to wait for an idle consumer before removing it. A consumer is considered idle when it's not making requests or heartbeats.
consumer_instance_timeout.name: consumer_instance_timeout_ms

consumer_offsets_topic_batch_cache_enabl.description: This property lets you enable the batch cache for the consumer offsets topic. By default, the cache for consumer offsets topic is disabled. Changing this property is not recommended in production systems, as it may affect performance. The change is applied only after the restart.
consumer_offsets_topic_batch_cache_enabl.name: consumer_offsets_topic_batch_cache_enabled

consumer_request_max_bytes.description: Maximum bytes to fetch per request.
consumer_request_max_bytes.name: consumer_request_max_bytes

consumer_request_min_bytes.description: Minimum bytes to fetch per request.
consumer_request_min_bytes.name: consumer_request_min_bytes

consumer_request_timeout.description: Interval (in milliseconds) for consumer request timeout.
consumer_request_timeout.name: consumer_request_timeout_ms

controller_backend_housekeeping_interval.description: Interval between iterations of controller backend housekeeping loop.
controller_backend_housekeeping_interval.name: controller_backend_housekeeping_interval_ms

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulation in controller ACLs and users operations limit.
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_acls_and_users_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulation in controller configuration operations limit.
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_configuration_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulation in controller move operations limit.
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_move_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulation in controller node management operations limit.
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_node_management_operations

controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.description: Maximum capacity of rate limit accumulationin controller topic operations limit
controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacit.name: controller_log_accummulation_rps_capacity_topic_operations

controller_snapshot_max_age_sec.description: Maximum amount of time before Redpanda attempts to create a controller snapshot after a new controller command appears.
controller_snapshot_max_age_sec.name: controller_snapshot_max_age_sec

core_balancing_continuous.description: If set to `true`, move partitions between cores in runtime to maintain balanced partition distribution.
core_balancing_continuous.name: core_balancing_continuous

core_balancing_debounce_timeout.description: Interval, in milliseconds, between trigger and invocation of core balancing.
core_balancing_debounce_timeout.name: core_balancing_debounce_timeout

core_balancing_on_core_count_change.description: If set to `true`, and if after a restart the number of cores changes, Redpanda will move partitions between cores to maintain balanced partition distribution.
core_balancing_on_core_count_change.name: core_balancing_on_core_count_change

cpu_profiler_sample_period_ms.description: The sample period for the CPU profiler.
cpu_profiler_sample_period_ms.name: cpu_profiler_sample_period_ms

crash_loop_limit.description: A limit on the number of consecutive times a broker can crash within one hour before its crash-tracking logic is reset. This limit prevents a broker from getting stuck in an infinite cycle of crashes. For more information see https://docs.redpanda.com/current/reference/properties/broker-properties/#crash_loop_limit.
crash_loop_limit.name: crash_loop_limit

crash_loop_sleep_sec.description: The amount of time the broker sleeps before terminating the process when it reaches the number of consecutive times a broker can crash. For more information, see https://docs.redpanda.com/current/reference/properties/broker-properties/#crash_loop_limit.
crash_loop_sleep_sec.name: crash_loop_sleep_sec

create_topic_timeout_ms.description: Timeout, in milliseconds, to wait for new topic creation.
create_topic_timeout_ms.name: create_topic_timeout_ms

data_directory.description: Path to the directory for storing Redpanda's streaming data files.
data_directory.name: data_directory

data_transforms_binary_max_size.description: The maximum size for a deployable WebAssembly binary that the broker can store.
data_transforms_binary_max_size.name: data_transforms_binary_max_size

data_transforms_commit_interval_ms.description: The commit interval at which data transforms progress.
data_transforms_commit_interval_ms.name: data_transforms_commit_interval_ms

data_transforms_enabled.description: Enables WebAssembly-powered data transforms directly in the broker. When `data_transforms_enabled` is set to `true`, Redpanda reserves memory for data transforms, even if no transform functions are currently deployed. This memory reservation ensures that adequate resources are available for transform functions when they are needed, but it also means that some memory is allocated regardless of usage.
data_transforms_enabled.name: data_transforms_enabled

data_transforms_logging_buffer_capacity_.description: Buffer capacity for transform logs, per shard. Buffer occupancy is calculated as the total size of buffered log messages; that is, logs emitted but not yet produced.
data_transforms_logging_buffer_capacity_.name: data_transforms_logging_buffer_capacity_bytes

data_transforms_logging_flush_interval_m.description: Flush interval for transform logs. When a timer expires, pending logs are collected and published to the `transform_logs` topic.
data_transforms_logging_flush_interval_m.name: data_transforms_logging_flush_interval_ms

data_transforms_logging_line_max_bytes.description: Transform log lines truncate to this length. Truncation occurs after any character escaping.
data_transforms_logging_line_max_bytes.name: data_transforms_logging_line_max_bytes

data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservat.description: The amount of memory to reserve per core for data transform (Wasm) virtual machines. Memory is reserved on boot. The maximum number of functions that can be deployed to a cluster is equal to `data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservation` / `data_transforms_per_function_memory_limit`.
data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservat.name: data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservation

data_transforms_per_function_memory_limi.description: The amount of memory to give an instance of a data transform (Wasm) virtual machine. The maximum number of functions that can be deployed to a cluster is equal to `data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservation` / `data_transforms_per_function_memory_limit`.
data_transforms_per_function_memory_limi.name: data_transforms_per_function_memory_limit

data_transforms_read_buffer_memory_perce.description: The percentage of available memory in the transform subsystem to use for read buffers.
data_transforms_read_buffer_memory_perce.name: data_transforms_read_buffer_memory_percentage

data_transforms_runtime_limit_ms.description: The maximum amount of runtime to start up a data transform, and the time it takes for a single record to be transformed.
data_transforms_runtime_limit_ms.name: data_transforms_runtime_limit_ms

data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_perc.description: The percentage of available memory in the transform subsystem to use for write buffers.
data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_perc.name: data_transforms_write_buffer_memory_percentage

datalake_coordinator_snapshot_max_delay_.description: Maximum amount of time the coordinator waits to snapshot after a command appears in the log.
datalake_coordinator_snapshot_max_delay_.name: datalake_coordinator_snapshot_max_delay_secs

datalake_disk_space_monitor_enable.description: Option to explicitly disable enforcement of datalake disk space usage
datalake_disk_space_monitor_enable.name: datalake_disk_space_monitor_enable

datalake_disk_usage_overage_coeff.description: The datalake disk usage monitor reclaims the overage multiplied by this this coefficient to compensate for data that is written during the idle period between control loop invocations.
datalake_disk_usage_overage_coeff.name: datalake_disk_usage_overage_coeff

datalake_scheduler_block_size_bytes.description: Size, in bytes, of each memory block reserved for record translation, as tracked by the datalake scheduler.
datalake_scheduler_block_size_bytes.name: datalake_scheduler_block_size_bytes

datalake_scheduler_disk_reservation_bloc.description: The size, in bytes, of the block of disk reservation that the datalake manager will assign to each datalake scheduler when it runs out of local reservation.
datalake_scheduler_disk_reservation_bloc.name: datalake_scheduler_disk_reservation_block_size

datalake_scheduler_max_concurrent_transl.description: The maximum number of translations that the datalake scheduler will allow to run at a given time. If a translation is requested but the number of running translations exceeds this value, the request will be put to sleep temporarily, polling until capacity becomes available.
datalake_scheduler_max_concurrent_transl.name: datalake_scheduler_max_concurrent_translations

datalake_scheduler_time_slice_ms.description: Time, in milliseconds, for a datalake translation as scheduled by the datalake scheduler. After a translation is scheduled, it will run until either a) the time specified has elapsed or b) all pending records on its source partition have been translated.
datalake_scheduler_time_slice_ms.name: datalake_scheduler_time_slice_ms

datalake_scratch_space_size_bytes.description: Size, in bytes, of the amount of scratch space datalake should use.
datalake_scratch_space_size_bytes.name: datalake_scratch_space_size_bytes

datalake_scratch_space_soft_limit_size_p.description: Size of the scratch space datalake soft limit expressed as a percentage of the datalake_scratch_space_size_bytes configuration value.
datalake_scratch_space_soft_limit_size_p.name: datalake_scratch_space_soft_limit_size_percent

datalake_translator_flush_bytes.description: Size, in bytes, of the amount of per translator data that may be flushed to disk before the translator will upload and remove its current on disk data.
datalake_translator_flush_bytes.name: datalake_translator_flush_bytes

debug_bundle_auto_removal_seconds.description: If set, how long debug bundles are kept in the debug bundle storage directory after they are created. If not set, debug bundles are kept indefinitely.
debug_bundle_auto_removal_seconds.name: debug_bundle_auto_removal_seconds

debug_bundle_storage_dir.description: Path to the debug bundle storage directory. Note: Changing this path does not clean up existing debug bundles. If not set, the debug bundle is stored in the Redpanda data directory specified in the redpanda.yaml broker configuration file.
debug_bundle_storage_dir.name: debug_bundle_storage_dir

debug_load_slice_warning_depth.description: The recursion depth after which debug logging is enabled automatically for the log reader.
debug_load_slice_warning_depth.name: debug_load_slice_warning_depth

default_leaders_preference.description: Default settings for preferred location of topic partition leaders. It can be either "none" (no preference), or "racks:<rack1>,<rack2>,..." (prefer brokers with rack id from the list).
default_leaders_preference.name: default_leaders_preference

default_num_windows.description: Default number of quota tracking windows.
default_num_windows.name: default_num_windows

default_topic_partitions.description: Default number of partitions per topic.
default_topic_partitions.name: default_topic_partitions

default_topic_replication.description: Default replication factor for new topics.
default_topic_replication.name: default_topic_replications

default_window_sec.description: Default quota tracking window size in milliseconds.
default_window_sec.name: default_window_sec

developer_mode.description: Skips most of the checks performed at startup, not recomended for production use
developer_mode.name: developer_mode

development_feature_property_testing_onl.description: Development feature property for testing only.
development_feature_property_testing_onl.name: development_feature_property_testing_only

disable_batch_cache.description: Disable batch cache in log manager.
disable_batch_cache.name: disable_batch_cache

disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests.description: Disables the cluster recovery loop. This property is used to simplify testing and should not be set in production.
disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests.name: disable_cluster_recovery_loop_for_tests

disable_metrics.description: Disable registering the metrics exposed on the internal `/metrics` endpoint.
disable_metrics.name: disable_metrics

disable_public_metrics.description: Disable registering the metrics exposed on the `/public_metrics` endpoint.
disable_public_metrics.name: disable_public_metrics

disk_reservation_percent.description: The percentage of total disk capacity that Redpanda will avoid using. This applies both when cloud cache and log data share a disk, as well as when cloud cache uses a dedicated disk. It is recommended to not run disks near capacity to avoid blocking I/O due to low disk space, as well as avoiding performance issues associated with SSD garbage collection.
disk_reservation_percent.name: disk_reservation_percent

emergency_disable_data_transforms.description: Override the cluster property `data_transforms_enabled` and disable Wasm-powered data transforms. This is an emergency shutoff button.
emergency_disable_data_transforms.name: emergency_disable_data_transforms

empty_seed_starts_cluster.description: Controls how a new cluster is formed. All brokers in a cluster must have the same value. See how the `empty_seed_starts_cluster` setting works with the `seed_servers` setting to form a cluster. For backward compatibility, `true` is the default. Redpanda recommends using `false` in production environments to prevent accidental cluster formation.
empty_seed_starts_cluster.name: empty_seed_starts_cluster

enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add.description: Enable automatic partition rebalancing when new nodes are added
enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add.name: enable_auto_rebalance_on_node_add

enable_cluster_metadata_upload_loop.description: Enables cluster metadata uploads. Required for whole cluster restore.
enable_cluster_metadata_upload_loop.name: enable_cluster_metadata_upload_loop

enable_consumer_group_metrics.description: List of enabled consumer group metrics. Accepted Values: `group`, `partition`, `consumer_lag`
enable_consumer_group_metrics.name: enable_consumer_group_metrics

enable_controller_log_rate_limiting.description: Limits the write rate for the controller log.
enable_controller_log_rate_limiting.name: enable_controller_log_rate_limiting

enable_developmental_unrecoverable_data_.description: Development features should never be enabled in a production cluster, or any cluster where stability, data loss, or the ability to upgrade are a concern. To enable experimental features, set the value of this configuration option to the current unix epoch expressed in seconds. The value must be within one hour of the current time on the broker.Once experimental features are enabled they cannot be disabled
enable_developmental_unrecoverable_data_.name: enable_developmental_unrecoverable_data_corrupting_features

enable_host_metrics.description: Enable exporting of some host metrics like /proc/diskstats, /proc/snmp and /proc/net/netstat
enable_host_metrics.name: enable_host_metrics

enable_metrics_reporter.description: Enable the cluster metrics reporter. If `true`, the metrics reporter collects and exports to Redpanda Data a set of customer usage metrics at the interval set by `metrics_reporter_report_interval`. The cluster metrics of the metrics reporter are different from the monitoring metrics. * The metrics reporter exports customer usage metrics for consumption by Redpanda Data.* Monitoring metrics are exported for consumption by Redpanda users.
enable_metrics_reporter.name: enable_metrics_reporter

enable_pid_file.description: Enable PID file. You should not need to change.
enable_pid_file.name: enable_pid_file

enable_sasl.description: Enable SASL authentication for Kafka connections. Authorization is required to modify this property. See also `kafka_enable_authorization`.
enable_sasl.name: enable_sasl

enable_schema_id_validation.description: Mode to enable server-side schema ID validation. Accepted Values: * `none`: Schema validation is disabled (no schema ID checks are done). Associated topic properties cannot be modified. * `redpanda`: Schema validation is enabled. Only Redpanda topic properties are accepted. * `compat`: Schema validation is enabled. Both Redpanda and compatible topic properties are accepted.
enable_schema_id_validation.name: enable_schema_id_validation

enable_usage.description: Enables the usage tracking mechanism, storing windowed history of kafka/cloud_storage metrics over time.
enable_usage.name: enable_usage

features_auto_enable.description: Whether new feature flags auto-activate after upgrades (true) or must wait for manual activation via the Admin API (false).
features_auto_enable.name: features_auto_enable

fetch_max_bytes.description: Maximum number of bytes returned in a fetch request.
fetch_max_bytes.name: fetch_max_bytes

fetch_pid_d_coeff.description: Derivative coefficient for fetch PID controller.
fetch_pid_d_coeff.name: fetch_pid_d_coeff

fetch_pid_i_coeff.description: Integral coefficient for fetch PID controller.
fetch_pid_i_coeff.name: fetch_pid_i_coeff

fetch_pid_max_debounce_ms.description: The maximum debounce time the fetch PID controller will apply, in milliseconds.
fetch_pid_max_debounce_ms.name: fetch_pid_max_debounce_ms

fetch_pid_p_coeff.description: Proportional coefficient for fetch PID controller.
fetch_pid_p_coeff.name: fetch_pid_p_coeff

fetch_pid_target_utilization_fraction.description: A fraction, between 0 and 1, for the target reactor utilization of the fetch scheduling group.
fetch_pid_target_utilization_fraction.name: fetch_pid_target_utilization_fraction

fetch_read_strategy.description: The strategy used to fulfill fetch requests. * `polling`: Repeatedly polls every partition in the request for new data. The polling interval is set by `fetch_reads_debounce_timeout` (deprecated). * `non_polling`: The backend is signaled when a partition has new data, so Redpanda does not need to repeatedly read from every partition in the fetch. Redpanda Data recommends using this value for most workloads, because it can improve fetch latency and CPU utilization. * `non_polling_with_debounce`: This option behaves like `non_polling`, but it includes a debounce mechanism with a fixed delay specified by `fetch_reads_debounce_timeout` at the start of each fetch. By introducing this delay, Redpanda can accumulate more data before processing, leading to fewer fetch operations and returning larger amounts of data. Enabling this option reduces reactor utilization, but it may also increase end-to-end latency.
fetch_read_strategy.name: fetch_read_strategy

fetch_reads_debounce_timeout.description: Time to wait for the next read in fetch requests when the requested minimum bytes was not reached.
fetch_reads_debounce_timeout.name: fetch_reads_debounce_timeout

fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms.description: Time duration after which the inactive fetch session is removed from the fetch session cache. Fetch sessions are used to implement the incremental fetch requests where a consumer does not send all requested partitions to the server but the server tracks them for the consumer.
fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms.name: fetch_session_eviction_timeout_ms

fips_mode.description: Controls whether Redpanda starts in FIPS mode.  This property allows for three values: `disabled` - Redpanda does not start in FIPS mode. `permissive` - Redpanda performs the same check as enabled, but a warning is logged, and Redpanda continues to run. Redpanda loads the OpenSSL FIPS provider into the OpenSSL library. After this completes, Redpanda is operating in FIPS mode, which means that the TLS cipher suites available to users are limited to the TLSv1.2 and TLSv1.3 NIST-approved cryptographic methods. `enabled` - Redpanda verifies that the operating system is enabled for FIPS by checking `/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled`. If the file does not exist or does not return `1`, Redpanda immediately exits.
fips_mode.name: fips_mode

group_initial_rebalance_delay.description: Delay added to the rebalance phase to wait for new members.
group_initial_rebalance_delay.name: group_initial_rebalance_delay

group_max_session_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed session timeout for registered consumers. Longer timeouts give consumers more time to process messages in between heartbeats at the cost of a longer time to detect failures.
group_max_session_timeout_ms.name: group_max_session_timeout_ms

group_min_session_timeout_ms.description: The minimum allowed session timeout for registered consumers. Shorter timeouts result in quicker failure detection at the cost of more frequent consumer heartbeating, which can overwhelm broker resources.
group_min_session_timeout_ms.name: group_min_session_timeout_ms

group_offset_retention_check_ms.description: Frequency rate at which the system should check for expired group offsets.
group_offset_retention_check_ms.name: group_offset_retention_check_ms

group_offset_retention_sec.description: Consumer group offset retention seconds. To disable offset retention, set this to null.
group_offset_retention_sec.name: group_offset_retention_sec

group_topic_partitions.description: Number of partitions in the internal group membership topic.
group_topic_partitions.name: group_topic_partitions

health_manager_tick_interval.description: How often the health manager runs.
health_manager_tick_interval.name: health_manager_tick_interval

health_monitor_max_metadata_age.description: Maximum age of the metadata cached in the health monitor of a non-controller broker.
health_monitor_max_metadata_age.name: health_monitor_max_metadata_age

health_monitor_tick_interval.description: How often health monitor refresh cluster state
health_monitor_tick_interval.name: health_monitor_tick_interval

http_authentication.description: A list of supported HTTP authentication mechanisms. Accepted Values: `BASIC`, `OIDC`
http_authentication.name: http_authentication

iceberg_backlog_controller_i_coeff.description: Integral coefficient for the Iceberg backlog controller. The error is integrated (accumulated) over time and the aggregated value contributes to the datalake translation priority with this coefficient.
iceberg_backlog_controller_i_coeff.name: iceberg_backlog_controller_i_coeff

iceberg_backlog_controller_p_coeff.description: Proportional coefficient for the Iceberg backlog controller. Number of shares assigned to the datalake scheduling group will be proportional to the backlog size error.
iceberg_backlog_controller_p_coeff.name: iceberg_backlog_controller_p_coeff

iceberg_catalog_base_location.description: Base path for the cloud-storage-object-backed Iceberg filesystem catalog. After Iceberg is enabled, do not change this value.
iceberg_catalog_base_location.name: iceberg_catalog_base_location

iceberg_catalog_commit_interval_ms.description: The frequency at which the Iceberg coordinator commits topic files to the catalog. This is the interval between commit transactions across all topics monitored by the coordinator, not the interval between individual commits.
iceberg_catalog_commit_interval_ms.name: iceberg_catalog_commit_interval_ms

iceberg_catalog_type.description: Iceberg catalog type that Redpanda will use to commit table metadata updates. Supported types: 'rest', 'object_storage'
iceberg_catalog_type.name: iceberg_catalog_type

iceberg_default_partition_spec.description: Default value for the redpanda.iceberg.partition.spec topic property that determines the partition spec for the Iceberg table corresponding to the topic. If this property is not set and AWS Glue is being used as the Iceberg REST catalog, the default value will be overridden by an empty partition spec, for compatibility with AWS Glue.
iceberg_default_partition_spec.name: iceberg_default_partition_spec

iceberg_delete.description: Default value for the redpanda.iceberg.delete topic property that determines if the corresponding Iceberg table is deleted upon deleting the topic.
iceberg_delete.name: iceberg_delete

iceberg_disable_automatic_snapshot_expir.description: Whether to disable automatic Iceberg snapshot expiry. This may be useful if the Iceberg catalog expects to perform snapshot expiry on its own.
iceberg_disable_automatic_snapshot_expir.name: iceberg_disable_automatic_snapshot_expiry

iceberg_disable_snapshot_tagging.description: Whether to disable tagging of Iceberg snapshots. These tags are used to ensure that the snapshots that Redpanda writes are retained during snapshot removal, which in turn, helps Redpanda ensure exactly once delivery of records. Disabling tags is therefore not recommended, but may be useful if the Iceberg catalog does not support tags.
iceberg_disable_snapshot_tagging.name: iceberg_disable_snapshot_tagging

iceberg_enabled.description: Enables the translation of topic data into Iceberg tables. Setting iceberg_enabled to true activates the feature at the cluster level, but each topic must also set the redpanda.iceberg.enabled topic-level property to true to use it. If iceberg_enabled is set to false, the feature is disabled for all topics in the cluster, overriding any topic-level settings.
iceberg_enabled.name: iceberg_enabled

iceberg_invalid_record_action.description: Default value for the redpanda.iceberg.invalid.record.action topic property.
iceberg_invalid_record_action.name: iceberg_invalid_record_action

iceberg_latest_schema_cache_ttl_ms.description: The TTL for the cache in translation that stores the latest schema when using the `latest_protobuf_value` iceberg mode.
iceberg_latest_schema_cache_ttl_ms.name: iceberg_latest_schema_cache_ttl_ms

iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode.description: The authentication mode for client requests made to the Iceberg catalog. Choose from: `none`, `bearer`, `oauth2`, and `aws_sigv4`. In `bearer` mode, the token specified in `iceberg_rest_catalog_token` is used unconditonally, and no attempts are made to refresh the token. In `oauth2` mode, the credentials specified in `iceberg_rest_catalog_client_id` and `iceberg_rest_catalog_client_secret` are used to obtain a bearer token from the URI defined by `iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_server_uri`. In `aws_sigv4` mode, the same AWS credentials used for cloud storage (see `cloud_storage_region`, `cloud_storage_access_key`, `cloud_storage_secret_key`, and `cloud_storage_credentials_source`) are used to sign requests to AWS Glue catalog with SigV4.
iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode

iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_access_key.description: AWS access key for Iceberg REST catalog SigV4 authentication. If not set, falls back to cloud_storage_access_key when using aws_sigv4 authentication mode.
iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_access_key.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_access_key

iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_credentials_sou.description: Source of AWS credentials for Iceberg REST catalog SigV4 authentication. If not set, falls back to cloud_storage_credentials_source when using aws_sigv4 authentication mode. Accepted values: config_file, aws_instance_metadata, sts, gcp_instance_metadata, azure_vm_instance_metadata, azure_aks_oidc_federation.
iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_credentials_sou.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_credentials_source

iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_region.description: AWS region for Iceberg REST catalog SigV4 authentication. If not set, falls back to cloud_storage_region when using aws_sigv4 authentication mode.
iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_region.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_region

iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key for Iceberg REST catalog SigV4 authentication. If not set, falls back to cloud_storage_secret_key when using aws_sigv4 authentication mode.
iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_secret_key.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_secret_key

iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_service_name.description: AWS service name for SigV4 signing when using aws_sigv4 authentication mode. Defaults to 'glue' for AWS Glue Data Catalog. Can be changed to support other AWS services that provide Iceberg REST catalog APIs.
iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_service_name.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_aws_service_name

iceberg_rest_catalog_base_location.description: Base URI for the Iceberg REST catalog. If unset, the REST catalog server determines the location. Some REST catalogs, like AWS Glue, require the client to set this. After Iceberg is enabled, do not change this value.
iceberg_rest_catalog_base_location.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_base_location

iceberg_rest_catalog_client_id.description: Iceberg REST catalog user ID. This ID is used to query the catalog API for the OAuth token. Required if catalog type is set to `rest` and `iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode` is set to `oauth2`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_client_id.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_client_id

iceberg_rest_catalog_client_secret.description: Secret to authenticate against Iceberg REST catalog. Required if catalog type is set to `rest` and `iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode` is set to `oauth2`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_client_secret.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_client_secret

iceberg_rest_catalog_crl.description: The contents of a certificate revocation list for `iceberg_rest_catalog_trust`. Takes precedence over `iceberg_rest_catalog_crl_file`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_crl.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_crl

iceberg_rest_catalog_crl_file.description: Path to certificate revocation list for `iceberg_rest_catalog_trust_file`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_crl_file.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_crl_file

iceberg_rest_catalog_endpoint.description: URL of Iceberg REST catalog endpoint
iceberg_rest_catalog_endpoint.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_endpoint

iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_scope.description: The OAuth scope used to retrieve access tokens for Iceberg catalog authentication. Only meaningful when `iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode` is set to `oauth2`
iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_scope.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_scope

iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_server_uri.description: The OAuth URI used to retrieve access tokens for Iceberg catalog authentication. If left undefined, the deprecated Iceberg catalog endpoint `/v1/oauth/tokens` is used instead.
iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_server_uri.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_oauth2_server_uri

iceberg_rest_catalog_request_timeout_ms.description: Maximum length of time that Redpanda waits for a response from the REST catalog before aborting the request
iceberg_rest_catalog_request_timeout_ms.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_request_timeout_ms

iceberg_rest_catalog_token.description: Token used to access the REST Iceberg catalog. Required if `iceberg_rest_catalog_authentication_mode` is set to `bearer`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_token.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_token

iceberg_rest_catalog_trust.description: The contents of a certificate chain to trust for the REST Iceberg catalog. Takes precedence over `iceberg_rest_catalog_trust_file`.
iceberg_rest_catalog_trust.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_trust

iceberg_rest_catalog_trust_file.description: Path to a file containing a certificate chain to trust for the REST Iceberg catalog
iceberg_rest_catalog_trust_file.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_trust_file

iceberg_rest_catalog_warehouse.description: Warehouse to use for the Iceberg REST catalog. Redpanda will query the catalog for configurations specific to the warehouse, for example, using it to automatically configure the appropriate prefix.
iceberg_rest_catalog_warehouse.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_warehouse

iceberg_target_backlog_size.description: Total size of the datalake translation backlog that the backlog controller will try to maintain. When a backlog size is larger than the setpoint a backlog controller will increase the translation scheduling group priority.
iceberg_target_backlog_size.name: iceberg_target_backlog_size

iceberg_target_lag_ms.description: Default value for the redpanda.iceberg.target.lag.ms topic property, which controls how often data in an Iceberg table is refreshed with new data from the corresponding Redpanda topic. Redpanda attempts to commit all the data produced to the topic within the lag target in a best effort fashion, subject to resource availability.
iceberg_target_lag_ms.name: iceberg_target_lag_ms

iceberg_throttle_backlog_size_ratio.description: Ration of the total backlog size to the disk space at which the throttle to iceberg producers is applied
iceberg_throttle_backlog_size_ratio.name: iceberg_throttle_backlog_size_ratio

id_allocator_batch_size.description: The ID allocator allocates messages in batches (each batch is a one log record) and then serves requests from memory without touching the log until the batch is exhausted.
id_allocator_batch_size.name: id_allocator_batch_size

id_allocator_log_capacity.description: Capacity of the `id_allocator` log in number of batches. After it reaches `id_allocator_stm`, it truncates the log's prefix.
id_allocator_log_capacity.name: id_allocator_log_capacity

initial_retention_local_target_bytes_def.description: Initial local retention size target for partitions of topics with Tiered Storage enabled. If no initial local target retention is configured all locally retained data will be delivered to learner when joining partition replica set.
initial_retention_local_target_bytes_def.name: initial_retention_local_target_bytes_default

initial_retention_local_target_ms_defaul.description: Initial local retention time target for partitions of topics with Tiered Storage enabled. If no initial local target retention is configured all locally retained data will be delivered to learner when joining partition replica set.
initial_retention_local_target_ms_defaul.name: initial_retention_local_target_ms_default

internal_topic_replication_factor.description: Target replication factor for internal topics.
internal_topic_replication_factor.name: internal_topic_replication_factor

join_retry_timeout_ms.description: Time between cluster join retries in milliseconds.
join_retry_timeout_ms.name: join_retry_timeout_ms

kafka_api.description: IP address and port of the Kafka API endpoint that handles requests.
kafka_api.name: kafka_api

kafka_api_tls.description: Transport Layer Security (TLS) configuration for the Kafka API endpoint.
kafka_api_tls.name: kafka_api_tls

kafka_batch_max_bytes.description: Maximum size of a batch processed by the server. If the batch is compressed, the limit applies to the compressed batch size.
kafka_batch_max_bytes.name: kafka_batch_max_bytes

kafka_connection_rate_limit.description: Maximum connections per second for one core. If `null` (the default), then the number of connections per second is unlimited.
kafka_connection_rate_limit.name: kafka_connection_rate_limit

kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides.description: Overrides the maximum connections per second for one core for the specified IP addresses (for example, `['127.0.0.1:90', '50.20.1.1:40']`)
kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides.name: kafka_connection_rate_limit_overrides

kafka_connections_max.description: Maximum number of Kafka client connections per broker. If `null`, the property is disabled.
kafka_connections_max.name: kafka_connections_max

kafka_connections_max_overrides.description: A list of IP addresses for which Kafka client connection limits are overridden and don't apply. For example, `(['127.0.0.1:90', '50.20.1.1:40']).`
kafka_connections_max_overrides.name: kafka_connections_max_overrides

kafka_connections_max_per_ip.description: Maximum number of Kafka client connections per IP address, per broker. If `null`, the property is disabled.
kafka_connections_max_per_ip.name: kafka_connections_max_per_ip

kafka_enable_authorization.description: Flag to require authorization for Kafka connections. If `null`, the property is disabled, and authorization is instead enabled by enable_sasl. * `null`: Ignored. Authorization is enabled with `enable_sasl`: `true` * `true`: authorization is required. * `false`: authorization is disabled.
kafka_enable_authorization.name: kafka_enable_authorization

kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_st.description: Whether to include Tiered Storage as a special remote:// directory in `DescribeLogDirs Kafka` API requests.
kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_st.name: kafka_enable_describe_log_dirs_remote_storage

kafka_enable_partition_reassignment.description: Enable the Kafka partition reassignment API.
kafka_enable_partition_reassignment.name: kafka_enable_partition_reassignment

kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch.description: Limit fetch responses to this many bytes, even if the total of partition bytes limits is higher.
kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch.name: kafka_max_bytes_per_fetch

kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fet.description: The size of the batch used to estimate memory consumption for fetch requests, in bytes. Smaller sizes allow more concurrent fetch requests per shard. Larger sizes prevent running out of memory because of too many concurrent fetch requests.
kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fet.name: kafka_memory_batch_size_estimate_for_fetch

kafka_memory_share_for_fetch.description: The share of Kafka subsystem memory that can be used for fetch read buffers, as a fraction of the Kafka subsystem memory amount.
kafka_memory_share_for_fetch.name: kafka_memory_share_for_fetch

kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules.description: Principal mapping rules for mTLS authentication on the Kafka API. If `null`, the property is disabled.
kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules.name: kafka_mtls_principal_mapping_rules

kafka_nodelete_topics.description: A list of topics that are protected from deletion and configuration changes by Kafka clients. Set by default to a list of Redpanda internal topics.
kafka_nodelete_topics.name: kafka_nodelete_topics

kafka_noproduce_topics.description: A list of topics that are protected from being produced to by Kafka clients. Set by default to a list of Redpanda internal topics.
kafka_noproduce_topics.name: kafka_noproduce_topics

kafka_qdc_depth_alpha.description: Smoothing factor for Kafka queue depth control depth tracking.
kafka_qdc_depth_alpha.name: kafka_qdc_depth_alpha

kafka_qdc_depth_update_ms.description: Update frequency for Kafka queue depth control.
kafka_qdc_depth_update_ms.name: kafka_qdc_depth_update_ms

kafka_qdc_idle_depth.description: Queue depth when idleness is detected in Kafka queue depth control.
kafka_qdc_idle_depth.name: kafka_qdc_idle_depth

kafka_qdc_latency_alpha.description: Smoothing parameter for Kafka queue depth control latency tracking.
kafka_qdc_latency_alpha.name: kafka_qdc_latency_alpha

kafka_qdc_max_depth.description: Maximum queue depth used in kafka queue depth control.
kafka_qdc_max_depth.name: kafka_qdc_max_depth

kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms.description: Maximum latency threshold for Kafka queue depth control depth tracking.
kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms.name: kafka_qdc_max_latency_ms

kafka_qdc_min_depth.description: Minimum queue depth used in Kafka queue depth control.
kafka_qdc_min_depth.name: kafka_qdc_min_depth

kafka_qdc_window_count.description: Number of windows used in kafka queue depth control latency tracking.
kafka_qdc_window_count.name: kafka_qdc_window_count

kafka_qdc_window_size_ms.description: Window size for Kafka queue depth control latency tracking.
kafka_qdc_window_size_ms.name: kafka_qdc_window_size_ms
