kafka_request_max_bytes.description: Maximum size of a single request processed using the Kafka API.
kafka_request_max_bytes.name: kafka_request_max_bytes

kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf.description: Maximum size of the user-space receive buffer. If `null`, this limit is not applied.
kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf.name: kafka_rpc_server_stream_recv_buf

kafka_rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.description: Size of the Kafka server TCP receive buffer. If `null`, the property is disabled.
kafka_rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.name: kafka_rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf

kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.description: Size of the Kafka server TCP transmit buffer. If `null`, the property is disabled.
kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.name: kafka_rpc_server_tcp_send_buf

kafka_sasl_max_reauth_ms.description: The maximum time between Kafka client reauthentications. If a client has not reauthenticated a connection within this time frame, that connection is torn down. If this property is not set (or set to `null`), session expiry is disabled, and a connection could live long after the client's credentials are expired or revoked.
kafka_sasl_max_reauth_ms.name: kafka_sasl_max_reauth_ms

kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacit.description: Per-shard capacity of the cache for validating schema IDs.
kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacit.name: kafka_schema_id_validation_cache_capacity

kafka_tcp_keepalive_idle_timeout_seconds.description: TCP keepalive idle timeout in seconds for Kafka connections. This describes the timeout between TCP keepalive probes that the remote site successfully acknowledged. Refers to the TCP_KEEPIDLE socket option. When changed, applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_idle_timeout_seconds.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_timeout

kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_secon.description: TCP keepalive probe interval in seconds for Kafka connections. This describes the timeout between unacknowledged TCP keepalives. Refers to the TCP_KEEPINTVL socket option. When changed, applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_secon.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_probe_interval_seconds

kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes.description: TCP keepalive unacknowledged probes until the connection is considered dead for Kafka connections. Refers to the TCP_KEEPCNT socket option. When changed, applies to new connections only.
kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes.name: kafka_tcp_keepalive_probes

kafka_throughput_control.description: List of throughput control groups that define exclusions from node-wide throughput limits. Clients excluded from node-wide throughput limits are still potentially subject to client-specific throughput limits. For more information see https://docs.redpanda.com/current/reference/properties/cluster-properties/#kafka_throughput_control.
kafka_throughput_control.name: kafka_throughput_control

kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys.description: List of Kafka API keys that are subject to cluster-wide and node-wide throughput limit control.
kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys.name: kafka_throughput_controlled_api_keys

kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps.description: The maximum rate of all ingress Kafka API traffic for a node. Includes all Kafka API traffic (requests, responses, headers, fetched data, produced data, etc.). If `null`, the property is disabled, and traffic is not limited.
kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps.name: kafka_throughput_limit_node_in_bps

kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps.description: The maximum rate of all egress Kafka traffic for a node. Includes all Kafka API traffic (requests, responses, headers, fetched data, produced data, etc.). If `null`, the property is disabled, and traffic is not limited.
kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps.name: kafka_throughput_limit_node_out_bps

kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold.description: Threshold for refilling the token bucket as part of enforcing throughput limits. This threshold is evaluated with each request for data. When the number of tokens to replenish exceeds this threshold, then tokens are added to the token bucket. This ensures that the atomic is not being updated for the token count with each request. The range for this threshold is automatically clamped to the corresponding throughput limit for ingress and egress.
kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold.name: kafka_throughput_replenish_threshold

kafka_topics_max.description: Maximum number of Kafka user topics that can be created. If `null`, then no limit is enforced.
kafka_topics_max.name: kafka_topics_max

leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard.description: Per shard limit for in-progress leadership transfers.
leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard.name: leader_balancer_transfer_limit_per_shard

legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled.description: Group offset retention is enabled by default starting in Redpanda version 23.1. To enable offset retention after upgrading from an older version, set this option to true.
legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled.name: legacy_group_offset_retention_enabled

legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation.description: Flag to enable a Redpanda cluster operator to use unsafe control characters within strings, such as consumer group names or user names. This flag applies only for Redpanda clusters that were originally on version 23.1 or earlier and have been upgraded to version 23.2 or later. Starting in version 23.2, newly-created Redpanda clusters ignore this property.
legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation.name: legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation

legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec.description: Period at which to log a warning about using unsafe strings containing control characters. If unsafe strings are permitted by `legacy_permit_unsafe_log_operation`, a warning will be logged at an interval specified by this property.
legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec.name: legacy_unsafe_log_warning_interval_sec

log_cleanup_policy.description: Default cleanup policy for topic logs. The topic property `cleanup.policy` overrides the value of `log_cleanup_policy` at the topic level.
log_cleanup_policy.name: log_cleanup_policy

log_compaction_interval_ms.description: How often to trigger background compaction.
log_compaction_interval_ms.name: log_compaction_interval_ms

log_compaction_merge_max_ranges.description: The maximum number of ranges of segments that can be processed in a single round of adjacent segment compaction. If `null` (the default value), no maximum is imposed on the number of ranges that can be processed at once. A value below 1 effectively disables adjacent merge compaction.
log_compaction_merge_max_ranges.name: log_compaction_merge_max_ranges

log_compaction_merge_max_segments_per_ra.description: The maximum number of segments that can be combined into a single segment during an adjacent merge operation. If `null` (the default value), no maximum is imposed on the number of segments that can be combined at once. A value below 2 effectively disables adjacent merge compaction.
log_compaction_merge_max_segments_per_ra.name: log_compaction_merge_max_segments_per_range

log_compaction_pause_use_sliding_window.description: Pause use of sliding window compaction. This should only be toggled to `true` when it is desired to force adjacent segment compaction. The memory reserved by `storage_compaction_key_map_memory` is not freed when this is set to `true`.
log_compaction_pause_use_sliding_window.name: log_compaction_pause_use_sliding_window

log_compression_type.description: Default topic compression type. The topic property `compression.type` overrides the value of `log_compression_type` at the topic level.
log_compression_type.name: log_compression_type

log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests.description: Disables the housekeeping loop for local storage. This property is used to simplify testing, and should not be set in production.
log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests.name: log_disable_housekeeping_for_tests

log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms.description: Threshold in milliseconds for alerting on messages with a timestamp after the broker's time, meaning the messages are in the future relative to the broker's clock.
log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms.name: log_message_timestamp_alert_after_ms

log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms.description: Threshold in milliseconds for alerting on messages with a timestamp before the broker's time, meaning the messages are in the past relative to the broker's clock. To disable this check, set to `null`.
log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms.name: log_message_timestamp_alert_before_ms

log_message_timestamp_type.description: Default timestamp type for topic messages (CreateTime or LogAppendTime). The topic property `message.timestamp.type` overrides the value of `log_message_timestamp_type` at the topic level.
log_message_timestamp_type.name: log_message_timestamp_type

log_retention_ms.description: The amount of time to keep a log file before deleting it (in milliseconds). If set to `-1`, no time limit is applied. This is a cluster-wide default when a topic does not set or disable `retention.ms`.
log_retention_ms.name: log_retention_ms

log_segment_ms.description: Default lifetime of log segments. If `null`, the property is disabled, and no default lifetime is set. Any value under 60 seconds (60000 ms) is rejected. This property can also be set in the Kafka API using the Kafka-compatible alias, `log.roll.ms`. The topic property `segment.ms` overrides the value of `log_segment_ms` at the topic level.
log_segment_ms.name: log_segment_ms

log_segment_ms_max.description: Upper bound on topic `segment.ms`: higher values will be clamped to this value.
log_segment_ms_max.name: log_segment_ms_max

log_segment_ms_min.description: Lower bound on topic `segment.ms`: lower values will be clamped to this value.
log_segment_ms_min.name: log_segment_ms_min

log_segment_size.description: Default log segment size in bytes for topics which do not set segment.bytes
log_segment_size.name: log_segment_size

log_segment_size_jitter_percent.description: Random variation to the segment size limit used for each partition.
log_segment_size_jitter_percent.name: log_segment_size_jitter_percent

log_segment_size_max.description: Upper bound on topic `segment.bytes`: higher values will be clamped to this limit.
log_segment_size_max.name: log_segment_size_max

log_segment_size_min.description: Lower bound on topic `segment.bytes`: lower values will be clamped to this limit.
log_segment_size_min.name: log_segment_size_min

lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled.description: Disable reusable preallocated buffers for LZ4 decompression.
lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled.name: lz4_decompress_reusable_buffers_disabled

max_compacted_log_segment_size.description: Maximum compacted segment size after consolidation.
max_compacted_log_segment_size.name: max_compacted_log_segment_size

max_compaction_lag_ms.description: For a compacted topic, the maximum time a message remains ineligible for compaction. The topic property `max.compaction.lag.ms` overrides this property.
max_compaction_lag_ms.name: max_compaction_lag_ms

max_concurrent_producer_ids.description: Maximum number of the active producers sessions. When the threshold is passed, Redpanda terminates old sessions. When an idle producer corresponding to the terminated session wakes up and produces, its message batches are rejected, and an out of order sequence error is emitted. Consumers don't affect this setting.
max_concurrent_producer_ids.name: max_concurrent_producer_ids

max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_sh.description: Maximum number of in-flight HTTP requests to HTTP Proxy permitted per shard.  Any additional requests above this limit will be rejected with a 429 error.
max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_sh.name: max_in_flight_pandaproxy_requests_per_shard

max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_p.description: Maximum number of in-flight HTTP requests to Schema Registry permitted per shard.  Any additional requests above this limit will be rejected with a 429 error.
max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_p.name: max_in_flight_schema_registry_requests_per_shard

max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms.description: Fail-safe maximum throttle delay on Kafka requests.
max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms.name: max_kafka_throttle_delay_ms

max_transactions_per_coordinator.description: Specifies the maximum number of active transaction sessions per coordinator. When the threshold is passed Redpanda terminates old sessions. When an idle producer corresponding to the terminated session wakes up and produces, it leads to its batches being rejected with invalid producer epoch or invalid_producer_id_mapping error (depends on the transaction execution phase).
max_transactions_per_coordinator.name: max_transactions_per_coordinator

members_backend_retry_ms.description: Time between members backend reconciliation loop retries.
members_backend_retry_ms.name: members_backend_retry_ms

memory_abort_on_alloc_failure.description: If `true`, the Redpanda process will terminate immediately when an allocation cannot be satisfied due to memory exhaustion. If false, an exception is thrown.
memory_abort_on_alloc_failure.name: memory_abort_on_alloc_failure

memory_allocation_warning_threshold.description: Threshold for log messages that contain a larger memory allocation than specified.
memory_allocation_warning_threshold.name: memory_allocation_warning_threshold

metadata_dissemination_retries.description: Number of attempts to look up a topic's metadata-like shard before a request fails. This configuration controls the number of retries that request handlers perform when internal topic metadata (for topics like tx, consumer offsets, etc) is missing. These topics are usually created on demand when users try to use the cluster for the first time and it may take some time for the creation to happen and the metadata to propagate to all the brokers (particularly the broker handling the request). In the mean time Redpanda waits and retry. This configuration controls the number retries.
metadata_dissemination_retries.name: metadata_dissemination_retries

metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms.description: Delay before retrying a topic lookup in a shard or other meta tables.
metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms.name: metadata_dissemination_retry_delay_ms

metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time to wait in metadata request for cluster health to be refreshed.
metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms.name: metadata_status_wait_timeout_ms

metrics_reporter_url.description: URL of the cluster metrics reporter.
metrics_reporter_url.name: metrics_reporter_url

min_cleanable_dirty_ratio.description: The minimum ratio between the number of bytes in "dirty" segments and the total number of bytes in closed segments that must be reached before a partition's log is eligible for compaction in a compact topic. The topic property `min.cleanable.dirty.ratio` overrides the value of `min_cleanable_dirty_ratio` at the topic level.
min_cleanable_dirty_ratio.name: min_cleanable_dirty_ratio

min_compaction_lag_ms.description: For a compacted topic, the minimum time a message remains uncompacted in the log. The topic property `min.compaction.lag.ms` overrides this property.
min_compaction_lag_ms.name: min_compaction_lag_ms

minimum_topic_replication.description: Minimum allowable replication factor for topics in this cluster. The set value must be positive, odd, and equal to or less than the number of available brokers. Changing this parameter only restricts newly-created topics. Redpanda returns an `INVALID_REPLICATION_FACTOR` error on any attempt to create a topic with a replication factor less than this property. If you change the `minimum_topic_replications` setting, the replication factor of existing topics remains unchanged. However, Redpanda will log a warning on start-up with a list of any topics that have fewer replicas than this minimum. For example, you might see a message such as `Topic X has a replication factor less than specified minimum: 1 < 3`.
minimum_topic_replication.name: minimum_topic_replications

mode_mutability.description: Enable modifications to the read-only `mode` of the Schema Registry.When set to `true`, the entire Schema Registry or its subjects can be switched to `READONLY` or `READWRITE`. This property is useful for preventing unwanted changes to the entire Schema Registry or specific subjects.
mode_mutability.name: mode_mutability

node_id.description: A number that uniquely identifies the broker within the cluster. If `null` (the default value), Redpanda automatically assigns an ID. If set, it must be non-negative value. The `node_id` property must not be changed after a broker joins the cluster.
node_id.name: node_id

node_id_overrides.description: List of node ID and UUID overrides to be applied at broker startup. Each entry includes the current UUID and desired ID and UUID. Each entry applies to a given node if and only if 'current' matches that node's current UUID.
node_id_overrides.name: node_id_overrides

node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout.description: How long after the last heartbeat request a node will wait before considering itself to be isolated.
node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout.name: node_isolation_heartbeat_timeout

node_management_operation_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for executing node management operations.
node_management_operation_timeout_ms.name: node_management_operation_timeout_ms

node_status_interval.description: Time interval between two node status messages. Node status messages establish liveness status outside of the Raft protocol.
node_status_interval.name: node_status_interval

node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms.description: Maximum backoff (in milliseconds) to reconnect to an unresponsive peer during node status liveness checks.
node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms.name: node_status_reconnect_max_backoff_ms

oidc_clock_skew_tolerance.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to allow for when validating the expiry claim in the token.
oidc_clock_skew_tolerance.name: oidc_clock_skew_tolerance

oidc_discovery_url.description: The URL pointing to the well-known discovery endpoint for the OIDC provider.
oidc_discovery_url.name: oidc_discovery_url

oidc_keys_refresh_interval.description: The frequency of refreshing the JSON Web Keys (JWKS) used to validate access tokens.
oidc_keys_refresh_interval.name: oidc_keys_refresh_interval

oidc_principal_mapping.description: Rule for mapping JWT payload claim to a Redpanda user principal.
oidc_principal_mapping.name: oidc_principal_mapping

oidc_token_audience.description: A string representing the intended recipient of the token.
oidc_token_audience.name: oidc_token_audience

openssl_config_file.description: Path to the configuration file used by OpenSSL to properly load the FIPS-compliant module.
openssl_config_file.name: openssl_config_file

openssl_module_directory.description: Path to the directory that contains the OpenSSL FIPS-compliant module. The filename that Redpanda looks for is `fips.so`.
openssl_module_directory.name: openssl_module_directory

pandaproxy_api.description: Rest API listen address and port
pandaproxy_api.name: pandaproxy_api

partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves.description: Number of partitions that can be reassigned at once.
partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves.name: partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves

partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_p.description: When the disk usage of a node exceeds this threshold, it triggers Redpanda to move partitions off of the node. This property applies only when partition_autobalancing_mode is set to `continuous`.
partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_p.name: partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_percent

partition_autobalancing_min_size_thresho.description: Minimum size of partition that is going to be prioritized when rebalancing a cluster due to the disk size threshold being breached. This value is calculated automatically by default.
partition_autobalancing_min_size_thresho.name: partition_autobalancing_min_size_threshold

partition_autobalancing_mode.description: Mode of partition balancing for a cluster. * `node_add`: partition balancing happens when a node is added. * `continuous`: partition balancing happens automatically to maintain optimal performance and availability, based on continuous monitoring for node changes (same as `node_add`) and also high disk usage. This option requires an Enterprise license, and it is customized by `partition_autobalancing_node_availability_timeout_sec` and `partition_autobalancing_max_disk_usage_percent` properties. * `off`: partition balancing is disabled. This option is not recommended for production clusters.
partition_autobalancing_mode.name: partition_autobalancing_mode

partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_s.description: Total size of partitions that autobalancer is going to move in one batch (deprecated, use partition_autobalancing_concurrent_moves to limit the autobalancer concurrency)
partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_s.name: partition_autobalancing_movement_batch_size_bytes

partition_autobalancing_node_availabilit.description: When a node is unavailable for at least this timeout duration, it triggers Redpanda to move partitions off of the node. This property applies only when `partition_autobalancing_mode` is set to `continuous`.
partition_autobalancing_node_availabilit.name: partition_autobalancing_node_availability_timeout_sec

partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_.description: If the number of scheduled tick moves drops by this ratio, a new tick is scheduled immediately. Valid values are (0, 1]. For example, with a value of 0.2 and 100 scheduled moves in a tick, a new tick is scheduled when the in-progress moves are fewer than 80.
partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_.name: partition_autobalancing_tick_moves_drop_threshold

partition_autobalancing_topic_aware.description: If `true`, Redpanda prioritizes balancing a topic’s partition replica count evenly across all brokers while it’s balancing the cluster’s overall partition count. Because different topics in a cluster can have vastly different load profiles, this better distributes the workload of the most heavily-used topics evenly across brokers.
partition_autobalancing_topic_aware.name: partition_autobalancing_topic_aware

partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_time.description: A threshold value to detect partitions which might have been stuck while shutting down. After this threshold, a watchdog in partition manager will log information about partition shutdown not making progress.
partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_time.name: partition_manager_shutdown_watchdog_timeout

pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests.description: Maximum number of Cross-core(Inter-shard communication) requests pending in HTTP Proxy and Schema Registry seastar::smp group. (For more details, see the `seastar::smp_service_group` documentation).
pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests.name: pp_sr_smp_max_non_local_requests

produce_ack_level.description: Number of acknowledgments the producer requires the leader to have received before considering a request complete.
produce_ack_level.name: produce_ack_level

produce_batch_delay.description: Delay (in milliseconds) to wait before sending batch.
produce_batch_delay.name: produce_batch_delay_ms

produce_batch_record_count.description: Number of records to batch before sending to broker.
produce_batch_record_count.name: produce_batch_record_count

produce_batch_size_bytes.description: Number of bytes to batch before sending to broker.
produce_batch_size_bytes.name: produce_batch_size_bytes

produce_compression_type.description: Enable or disable compression by the Kafka client. Specify `none` to disable compression or one of the supported types [gzip, snappy, lz4, zstd].
produce_compression_type.name: produce_compression_type

produce_shutdown_delay.description: Delay (in milliseconds) to allow for final flush of buffers before shutting down.
produce_shutdown_delay.name: produce_shutdown_delay_ms

quota_manager_gc_sec.description: Quota manager GC frequency in milliseconds.
quota_manager_gc_sec.name: quota_manager_gc_sec

rack.description: A label that identifies a failure zone. Apply the same label to all brokers in the same failure zone. When `enable_rack_awareness` is set to `true` at the cluster level, the system uses the rack labels to spread partition replicas across different failure zones.
rack.name: rack

raft_enable_longest_log_detection.description: Enables an additional step in leader election where a candidate is allowed to wait for all the replies from the broker it requested votes from. This may introduce a small delay when recovering from failure, but it prevents truncation if any of the replicas have more data than the majority.
raft_enable_longest_log_detection.name: raft_enable_longest_log_detection

raft_flush_timer_interval_ms.description: Interval of checking partition against the `raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes`, deprecated started 24.1, use raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms instead
raft_flush_timer_interval_ms.name: raft_flush_timer_interval_ms

raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures.description: The number of failed heartbeats after which an unresponsive TCP connection is forcibly closed. To disable forced disconnection, set to 0.
raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures.name: raft_heartbeat_disconnect_failures

raft_heartbeat_interval_ms.description: Number of milliseconds for Raft leader heartbeats.
raft_heartbeat_interval_ms.name: raft_heartbeat_interval_ms

raft_heartbeat_timeout_ms.description: Raft heartbeat RPC (remote procedure call) timeout. Raft uses a heartbeat mechanism to maintain leadership authority and to trigger leader elections. The `raft_heartbeat_interval_ms` is a periodic heartbeat sent by the partition leader to all followers to declare its leadership. If a follower does not receive a heartbeat within the `raft_heartbeat_timeout_ms`, then it triggers an election to choose a new partition leader.
raft_heartbeat_timeout_ms.name: raft_heartbeat_timeout_ms

raft_learner_recovery_rate.description: Raft learner recovery rate limit. Throttles the rate of data communicated to nodes (learners) that need to catch up to leaders. This rate limit is placed on a node sending data to a recovering node. Each sending node is limited to this rate. The recovering node accepts data as fast as possible according to the combined limits of all healthy nodes in the cluster. For example, if two nodes are sending data to the recovering node, and `raft_learner_recovery_rate` is 100 MB/sec, then the recovering node will recover at a rate of 200 MB/sec.
raft_learner_recovery_rate.name: raft_learner_recovery_rate

raft_max_buffered_follower_append_entrie.description: The total size of append entry requests that may be cached per shard, using Raft buffered protocol. When an entry is cached the leader can continue serving requests because the ordering of the cached requests cannot change. When the total size of cached requests reaches the set limit, back pressure is applied to throttle producers.
raft_max_buffered_follower_append_entrie.name: raft_max_buffered_follower_append_entries_bytes_per_shard

raft_max_inflight_follower_append_entrie.description: The maximum number of append entry requests that may be sent from raft groups on a Seastar shard to the current node and are awaiting a reply. This property replaces raft_max_concurrent_append_requests_per_follower.
raft_max_inflight_follower_append_entrie.name: raft_max_inflight_follower_append_entries_requests_per_shard

raft_max_recovery_memory.description: Maximum memory that can be used for reads in Raft recovery process by default 15% of total memory.
raft_max_recovery_memory.name: raft_max_recovery_memory

raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard.description: Number of partitions that may simultaneously recover data to a particular shard. This number is limited to avoid overwhelming nodes when they come back online after an outage.
raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard.name: raft_recovery_concurrency_per_shard

raft_recovery_default_read_size.description: Specifies the default size of a read issued during Raft follower recovery.
raft_recovery_default_read_size.name: raft_recovery_default_read_size

raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_m.description: Disables cross shard sharing used to throttle recovery traffic. Should only be used to debug unexpected problems.
raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_m.name: raft_recovery_throttle_disable_dynamic_mode

raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms.description: Maximum delay between two subsequent flushes. After this delay, the log is automatically force flushed.
raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms.name: raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms

raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes.description: Maximum number of bytes that are not flushed per partition. If the configured threshold is reached, the log is automatically flushed even if it has not been explicitly requested.
raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes.name: raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes

raft_replicate_batch_window_size.description: Maximum size of requests cached for replication.
raft_replicate_batch_window_size.name: raft_replicate_batch_window_size

raft_smp_max_non_local_requests.description: Maximum number of Cross-core(Inter-shard communication) requests pending in Raft seastar::smp group. For details, refer to the `seastar::smp_service_group` documentation).
raft_smp_max_non_local_requests.name: raft_smp_max_non_local_requests

raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for Raft's timeout_now RPC. This RPC is used to force a follower to dispatch a round of votes immediately.
raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms.name: raft_timeout_now_timeout_ms

raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms.description: Follower recovery timeout waiting period when transferring leadership.
raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms.name: raft_transfer_leader_recovery_timeout_ms

readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms.description: Duration after which inactive readers are evicted from cache.
readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms.name: readers_cache_eviction_timeout_ms

readers_cache_target_max_size.description: Maximum desired number of readers cached per NTP. This a soft limit, meaning that a number of readers in cache may temporarily increase as cleanup is performed in the background.
readers_cache_target_max_size.name: readers_cache_target_max_size

reclaim_batch_cache_min_free.description: Minimum amount of free memory maintained by the batch cache background reclaimer.
reclaim_batch_cache_min_free.name: reclaim_batch_cache_min_free

reclaim_growth_window.description: Starting from the last point in time when memory was reclaimed from the batch cache, this is the duration during which the amount of memory to reclaim grows at a significant rate, based on heuristics about the amount of available memory.
reclaim_growth_window.name: reclaim_growth_window

reclaim_stable_window.description: If the duration since the last time memory was reclaimed is longer than the amount of time specified in this property, the memory usage of the batch cache is considered stable, so only the minimum size (`reclaim_min_size`) is set to be reclaimed.
reclaim_stable_window.name: reclaim_stable_window

recovery_append_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for append entry requests issued while updating a stale follower.
recovery_append_timeout_ms.name: recovery_append_timeout_ms

recovery_mode_enabled.description: If `true`, start Redpanda in recovery mode, where user partitions are not loaded and only administrative operations are allowed.
recovery_mode_enabled.name: recovery_mode_enabled

release_cache_on_segment_roll.description: Flag for specifying whether or not to release cache when a full segment is rolled.
release_cache_on_segment_roll.name: release_cache_on_segment_roll

replicate_append_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for append entry requests issued while replicating entries.
replicate_append_timeout_ms.name: replicate_append_timeout_ms

retention_bytes.description: Default maximum number of bytes per partition on disk before triggering deletion of the oldest messages. If `null` (the default value), no limit is applied. The topic property `retention.bytes` overrides the value of `retention_bytes` at the topic level.
retention_bytes.name: retention_bytes

retention_local_strict.description: Flag to allow Tiered Storage topics to expand to consumable retention policy limits. When this flag is enabled, non-local retention settings are used, and local retention settings are used to inform data removal policies in low-disk space scenarios.
retention_local_strict.name: retention_local_strict

retention_local_strict_override.description: Trim log data when a cloud topic reaches its local retention limit. When this option is disabled Redpanda will allow partitions to grow past the local retention limit, and will be trimmed automatically as storage reaches the configured target size.
retention_local_strict_override.name: retention_local_strict_override

retention_local_target_bytes_default.description: Local retention size target for partitions of topics with object storage write enabled. If `null`, the property is disabled. This property can be overridden on a per-topic basis by setting `retention.local.target.bytes` in each topic enabled for Tiered Storage. Both `retention_local_target_bytes_default` and `retention_local_target_ms_default` can be set. The limit that is reached earlier is applied.
retention_local_target_bytes_default.name: retention_local_target_bytes_default

retention_local_target_capacity_bytes.description: The target capacity (in bytes) that log storage will try to use before additional retention rules take over to trim data to meet the target. When no target is specified, storage usage is unbounded. Redpanda Data recommends setting only one of `retention_local_target_capacity_bytes` or `retention_local_target_capacity_percent`. If both are set, the minimum of the two is used as the effective target capacity.
retention_local_target_capacity_bytes.name: retention_local_target_capacity_bytes

retention_local_target_capacity_percent.description: The target capacity in percent of unreserved space (`disk_reservation_percent`) that log storage will try to use before additional retention rules will take over to trim data in order to meet the target. When no target is specified storage usage is unbounded. Redpanda Data recommends setting only one of `retention_local_target_capacity_bytes` or `retention_local_target_capacity_percent`. If both are set, the minimum of the two is used as the effective target capacity.
retention_local_target_capacity_percent.name: retention_local_target_capacity_percent

retention_local_target_ms_default.description: Local retention time target for partitions of topics with object storage write enabled. This property can be overridden on a per-topic basis by setting `retention.local.target.ms` in each topic enabled for Tiered Storage. Both `retention_local_target_bytes_default` and `retention_local_target_ms_default` can be set. The limit that is reached first is applied.
retention_local_target_ms_default.name: retention_local_target_ms_default

retention_local_trim_interval.description: The period during which disk usage is checked for disk pressure, and data is optionally trimmed to meet the target.
retention_local_trim_interval.name: retention_local_trim_interval

retention_local_trim_overage_coeff.description: The space management control loop reclaims the overage multiplied by this this coefficient to compensate for data that is written during the idle period between control loop invocations.
retention_local_trim_overage_coeff.name: retention_local_trim_overage_coeff

retries.description: Number of times to retry a request to a broker.
retries.name: retries

retry_base_backoff.description: Delay (in milliseconds) for initial retry backoff.
retry_base_backoff.name: retry_base_backoff_ms

rm_sync_timeout_ms.description: Resource manager's synchronization timeout. Specifies the maximum time for this node to wait for the internal state machine to catch up with all events written by previous leaders before rejecting a request.
rm_sync_timeout_ms.name: rm_sync_timeout_ms

rpc_client_connections_per_peer.description: The maximum number of connections a broker will open to each of its peers.
rpc_client_connections_per_peer.name: rpc_client_connections_per_peer

rpc_server.description: IP address and port for the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) server.
rpc_server.name: rpc_server

rpc_server_compress_replies.description: Enable compression for internal RPC (remote procedure call) server replies.
rpc_server_compress_replies.name: rpc_server_compress_replies

rpc_server_listen_backlog.description: Maximum TCP connection queue length for Kafka server and internal RPC server. If `null` (the default value), no queue length is set.
rpc_server_listen_backlog.name: rpc_server_listen_backlog

rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.description: Internal RPC TCP receive buffer size. If `null` (the default value), no buffer size is set by Redpanda.
rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf.name: rpc_server_tcp_recv_buf

rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.description: Internal RPC TCP send buffer size. If `null` (the default value), then no buffer size is set by Redpanda.
rpc_server_tcp_send_buf.name: rpc_server_tcp_send_buf

rpc_server_tls.description: TLS configuration for the RPC server.
rpc_server_tls.name: rpc_server_tls

rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations.description: Rate limit for controller ACLs and user's operations.
rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations.name: rps_limit_acls_and_users_operations

rps_limit_configuration_operations.description: Rate limit for controller configuration operations.
rps_limit_configuration_operations.name: rps_limit_configuration_operations

rps_limit_move_operations.description: Rate limit for controller move operations.
rps_limit_move_operations.name: rps_limit_move_operations

rps_limit_node_management_operations.description: Rate limit for controller node management operations.
rps_limit_node_management_operations.name: rps_limit_node_management_operations

rps_limit_topic_operations.description: Rate limit for controller topic operations.
rps_limit_topic_operations.name: rps_limit_topic_operations

sampled_memory_profile.description: When `true`, memory allocations are sampled and tracked. A sampled live set of allocations can then be retrieved from the Admin API. Additionally, Redpanda will periodically log the top-n allocation sites.
sampled_memory_profile.name: memory_enable_memory_sampling

sasl_kerberos_config.description: The location of the Kerberos `krb5.conf` file for Redpanda.
sasl_kerberos_config.name: sasl_kerberos_config

sasl_kerberos_keytab.description: The location of the Kerberos keytab file for Redpanda.
sasl_kerberos_keytab.name: sasl_kerberos_keytab

sasl_kerberos_principal.description: The primary of the Kerberos Service Principal Name (SPN) for Redpanda.
sasl_kerberos_principal.name: sasl_kerberos_principal

sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping.description: Rules for mapping Kerberos principal names to Redpanda user principals.
sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping.name: sasl_kerberos_principal_mapping

sasl_mechanism.description: The SASL mechanism to use when connecting.
sasl_mechanism.name: sasl_mechanism

sasl_mechanisms.description: A list of supported SASL mechanisms. Accepted values: `SCRAM`, `GSSAPI`, `OAUTHBEARER`, `PLAIN`.  Note that in order to enable PLAIN, you must also enable SCRAM.
sasl_mechanisms.name: sasl_mechanisms

schema_registry_always_normalize.description: Always normalize schemas. If set, this overrides the normalize parameter in API requests.
schema_registry_always_normalize.name: schema_registry_always_normalize

schema_registry_api.description: Schema Registry API listener address and port
schema_registry_api.name: schema_registry_api

schema_registry_api_tls.description: TLS configuration for Schema Registry API.
schema_registry_api_tls.name: schema_registry_api_tls

schema_registry_enable_authorization.description: Enable ACL-based authorization for Schema Registry requests. When true, uses ACL-based authorization instead of the default public/user/superuser authorization model. When false, uses the default authorization model. Requires authentication to be enabled via schema_registry_api.authn_method.
schema_registry_enable_authorization.name: schema_registry_enable_authorization

schema_registry_replication_factor.description: Replication factor for internal `_schemas` topic.  If unset, defaults to `default_topic_replication`.
schema_registry_replication_factor.name: schema_registry_replication_factor

scram_password.description: Password to use for SCRAM authentication mechanisms.
scram_password.name: scram_password

scram_username.description: Username to use for SCRAM authentication mechanisms.
scram_username.name: scram_username

seed_servers.description: List of the seed servers used to join current cluster. If the `seed_servers` list is empty the node will be a cluster root and it will form a new cluster. When `empty_seed_starts_cluster` is `true`, Redpanda enables one broker with an empty `seed_servers` list to initiate a new cluster. The broker with an empty `seed_servers` becomes the cluster root, to which other brokers must connect to join the cluster.  Brokers looking to join the cluster should have their `seed_servers` populated with the cluster root's address, facilitating their connection to the cluster. Only one broker, the designated cluster root, should have an empty `seed_servers` list during the initial cluster bootstrapping. This ensures a single initiation point for cluster formation. When `empty_seed_starts_cluster` is `false`, Redpanda requires all brokers to start with a known set of brokers listed in `seed_servers`. The `seed_servers` list must not be empty and should be identical across these initial seed brokers, containing the addresses of all seed brokers. Brokers not included in the `seed_servers` list use it to discover and join the cluster, allowing for expansion beyond the foundational members. The `seed_servers` list must be consistent across all seed brokers to prevent cluster fragmentation and ensure stable cluster formation.
seed_servers.name: seed_servers

segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms.description: Maximum delay until buffered data is written.
segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms.name: segment_appender_flush_timeout_ms

space_management_enable.description: Option to explicitly disable automatic disk space management. If this property was explicitly disabled while using v23.2, it will remain disabled following an upgrade.
space_management_enable.name: space_management_enable

space_management_enable_override.description: Enable automatic space management. This option is ignored and deprecated in versions >= v23.3.
space_management_enable_override.name: space_management_enable_override

space_management_max_log_concurrency.description: Maximum parallel logs inspected during space management process.
space_management_max_log_concurrency.name: space_management_max_log_concurrency

space_management_max_segment_concurrency.description: Maximum parallel segments inspected during space management process.
space_management_max_segment_concurrency.name: space_management_max_segment_concurrency

storage_compaction_index_memory.description: Maximum number of bytes that may be used on each shard by compaction index writers.
storage_compaction_index_memory.name: storage_compaction_index_memory

storage_compaction_key_map_memory.description: Maximum number of bytes that may be used on each shard by compaction key-offset maps. Only applies when `log_compaction_use_sliding_window` is set to `true`.
storage_compaction_key_map_memory.name: storage_compaction_key_map_memory

storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_.description: Limit on `storage_compaction_key_map_memory`, expressed as a percentage of memory per shard, that bounds the amount of memory used by compaction key-offset maps. Memory per shard is computed after `data_transforms_per_core_memory_reservation`, and only applies when `log_compaction_use_sliding_window` is set to `true`.
storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_.name: storage_compaction_key_map_memory_limit_percent

storage_failure_injection_config_path.description: Path to the configuration file used for low level storage failure injection.
storage_failure_injection_config_path.name: storage_failure_injection_config_path

storage_failure_injection_enabled.description: If `true`, inject low level storage failures on the write path. Do _not_ use for production instances.
storage_failure_injection_enabled.name: storage_failure_injection_enabled

storage_ignore_cstore_hints.description: When set, cstore hints are ignored and not used for data access (but are otherwise generated).
storage_ignore_cstore_hints.name: storage_ignore_cstore_hints

storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec.description: The maximum number of seconds that a record's timestamp can be ahead of a Redpanda broker's clock and still be used when deciding whether to clean up the record for data retention. This property makes possible the timely cleanup of records from clients with clocks that are drastically unsynchronized relative to Redpanda. When determining whether to clean up a record with timestamp more than `storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec` seconds ahead of the broker, Redpanda ignores the record's timestamp and instead uses a valid timestamp of another record in the same segment, or (if another record's valid timestamp is unavailable) the timestamp of when the segment file was last modified (mtime). By default, `storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec` is disabled (null). To figure out whether to set `storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec` for your system: . Look for logs with segments that are unexpectedly large and not being cleaned up. . In the logs, search for records with unsynchronized timestamps that are further into the future than tolerable by your data retention and storage settings. For example, timestamps 60 seconds or more into the future can be considered to be too unsynchronized. . If you find unsynchronized timestamps throughout your logs, determine the number of seconds that the timestamps are ahead of their actual time, and set `storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec` to that value so data retention can proceed. . If you only find unsynchronized timestamps that are the result of transient behavior, you can disable `storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec`.
storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec.name: storage_ignore_timestamps_in_future_sec

storage_max_concurrent_replay.description: Maximum number of partitions' logs that will be replayed concurrently at startup, or flushed concurrently on shutdown.
storage_max_concurrent_replay.name: storage_max_concurrent_replay

storage_min_free_bytes.description: Threshold of minimum bytes free space before rejecting producers.
storage_min_free_bytes.name: storage_min_free_bytes

storage_read_buffer_size.description: Size of each read buffer (one per in-flight read, per log segment).
storage_read_buffer_size.name: storage_read_buffer_size

storage_read_readahead_count.description: How many additional reads to issue ahead of current read location.
storage_read_readahead_count.name: storage_read_readahead_count

storage_reserve_min_segments.description: The number of segments per partition that the system will attempt to reserve disk capacity for. For example, if the maximum segment size is configured to be 100 MB, and the value of this option is 2, then in a system with 10 partitions Redpanda will attempt to reserve at least 2 GB of disk space.
storage_reserve_min_segments.name: storage_reserve_min_segments

storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes.description: Threshold of minimum bytes free space before setting storage space alert.
storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes.name: storage_space_alert_free_threshold_bytes

storage_space_alert_free_threshold_perce.description: Threshold of minimum percent free space before setting storage space alert.
storage_space_alert_free_threshold_perce.name: storage_space_alert_free_threshold_percent

storage_strict_data_init.description: Requires that an empty file named `.redpanda_data_dir` be present in the broker configuration `data_directory`. If set to `true`, Redpanda will refuse to start if the file is not found in the data directory.
storage_strict_data_init.name: storage_strict_data_init

storage_target_replay_bytes.description: Target bytes to replay from disk on startup after clean shutdown: controls frequency of snapshots and checkpoints.
storage_target_replay_bytes.name: storage_target_replay_bytes

tls_certificate_name_format.description: The format of the certificates's distinguished name to use for mTLS principal mapping.  Legacy format would appear as 'C=US,ST=California,L=San Francisco,O=Redpanda,CN=redpanda', while rfc2253 format would appear as 'CN=redpanda,O=Redpanda,L=San Francisco,ST=California,C=US'.
tls_certificate_name_format.name: tls_certificate_name_format

tls_enable_renegotiation.description: TLS client-initiated renegotiation is considered unsafe and is by default disabled.  Only re-enable it if you are experiencing issues with your TLS-enabled client.  This option has no effect on TLSv1.3 connections as client-initiated renegotiation was removed.
tls_enable_renegotiation.name: tls_enable_renegotiation

tls_min_version.description: The minimum TLS version that Redpanda clusters support. This property prevents client applications from negotiating a downgrade to the TLS version when they make a connection to a Redpanda cluster.
tls_min_version.name: tls_min_version

tm_sync_timeout_ms.description: Transaction manager's synchronization timeout. Maximum time to wait for internal state machine to catch up before rejecting a request.
tm_sync_timeout_ms.name: tm_sync_timeout_ms

tombstone_retention_ms.description: The retention time for tombstone records and transaction markers in a compacted topic.
tombstone_retention_ms.name: tombstone_retention_ms

topic_fds_per_partition.description: File descriptors required per partition replica: topic creation is prevented if it would result in the ratio of file descriptor limit to partition replicas being lower than this value.
topic_fds_per_partition.name: topic_fds_per_partition

topic_label_aggregation_limit.description: When the number of topics exceeds this limit, the topic label in generated metrics will be aggregated. If `nullopt`, then there is no limit.
topic_label_aggregation_limit.name: topic_label_aggregation_limit

topic_memory_per_partition.description: Required memory in bytes per partition replica when creating or altering topics. The total size of the memory pool for partitions is the total memory available to Redpanda times topic_partitions_memory_allocation_percent, and then each partition created requires topic_memory_per_partition bytes from that pool. If insufficent memory is available, topic creation or alternation will fail.
topic_memory_per_partition.name: topic_memory_per_partition

topic_partitions_memory_allocation_perce.description: Percentage of total memory to reserve for topic partitions. See topic_memory_per_partition for details.
topic_partitions_memory_allocation_perce.name: topic_partitions_memory_allocation_percent

topic_partitions_per_shard.description: Maximum partition replicas per shard: topic creation is prevented if it would result in the ratio of partition replicas to shards being higher than this value.
topic_partitions_per_shard.name: topic_partitions_per_shard

topic_partitions_reserve_shard0.description: Reserved partition slots on shard (CPU core) 0 on each node.  If this is >= topic_partitions_per_shard, no data partitions will be scheduled on shard 0
topic_partitions_reserve_shard0.name: topic_partitions_reserve_shard0

transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy.description: Cleanup policy for a transaction coordinator topic. Accepted Values: `compact`, `delete`, `["compact","delete"]`, `none`
transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy.name: transaction_coordinator_cleanup_policy

transaction_coordinator_delete_retention.description: Delete segments older than this age. To ensure transaction state is retained as long as the longest-running transaction, make sure this is no less than `transactional_id_expiration_ms`.
transaction_coordinator_delete_retention.name: transaction_coordinator_delete_retention_ms

transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size.description: The size (in bytes) each log segment should be.
transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size.name: transaction_coordinator_log_segment_size

transaction_coordinator_partitions.description: Number of partitions for transactions coordinator.
transaction_coordinator_partitions.name: transaction_coordinator_partitions

transaction_max_timeout_ms.description: The maximum allowed timeout for transactions. If a client-requested transaction timeout exceeds this configuration, the broker returns an error during transactional producer initialization. This guardrail prevents hanging transactions from blocking consumer progress.
transaction_max_timeout_ms.name: transaction_max_timeout_ms

transactional_id_expiration_ms.description: Expiration time of producer IDs. Measured starting from the time of the last write until now for a given ID.
transactional_id_expiration_ms.name: transactional_id_expiration_ms

tx_log_stats_interval_s.description: How often to log per partition tx stats, works only with debug logging enabled.
tx_log_stats_interval_s.name: tx_log_stats_interval_s

tx_timeout_delay_ms.description: Delay before scheduling the next check for timed out transactions.
tx_timeout_delay_ms.name: tx_timeout_delay_ms

unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_re.description: Enables delete retention of consumer offsets topic. This is an internal-only configuration and should be enabled only after consulting with Redpanda support.
unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_re.name: unsafe_enable_consumer_offsets_delete_retention

upgrade_override_checks.description: Whether to violate safety checks when starting a Redpanda version newer than the cluster's consensus version.
upgrade_override_checks.name: upgrade_override_checks

usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec.description: The interval in which all usage stats are written to disk.
usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec.name: usage_disk_persistance_interval_sec

usage_num_windows.description: The number of windows to persist in memory and disk.
usage_num_windows.name: usage_num_windows

usage_window_width_interval_sec.description: The width of a usage window, tracking cloud and kafka ingress/egress traffic each interval.
usage_window_width_interval_sec.name: usage_window_width_interval_sec

use_fetch_scheduler_group.description: Use a separate scheduler group for fetch processing.
use_fetch_scheduler_group.name: use_fetch_scheduler_group

use_kafka_handler_scheduler_group.description: Use separate scheduler group to handle parsing Kafka protocol requests
use_kafka_handler_scheduler_group.name: use_kafka_handler_scheduler_group

use_produce_scheduler_group.description: Use a separate scheduler group for kafka produce requests processing.
use_produce_scheduler_group.name: use_produce_scheduler_group

verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max.description: Maximum duration in seconds for verbose (`TRACE` or `DEBUG`) logging. Values configured above this will be clamped. If null (the default) there is no limit. Can be overridden in the Admin API on a per-request basis.
verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max.name: verbose_logging_timeout_sec_max

virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids.description: Minimum number of active producers per virtual cluster.
virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids.name: virtual_cluster_min_producer_ids

wait_for_leader_timeout_ms.description: Timeout to wait for leadership in metadata cache.
wait_for_leader_timeout_ms.name: wait_for_leader_timeout_ms

write_caching_default.description: The default write caching mode to apply to user topics. Write caching acknowledges a message as soon as it is received and acknowledged on a majority of brokers, without waiting for it to be written to disk. With `acks=all`, this provides lower latency while still ensuring that a majority of brokers acknowledge the write. Fsyncs follow `raft_replica_max_pending_flush_bytes` and `raft_replica_max_flush_delay_ms`, whichever is reached first. The `write_caching_default` cluster property can be overridden with the `write.caching` topic property. Accepted values: * `true` * `false` * `disabled`: This takes precedence over topic overrides and disables write caching for the entire cluster.
write_caching_default.name: write_caching_default

zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes.description: Size of the zstd decompression workspace.
zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes.name: zstd_decompress_workspace_bytes
